story:
What is the show about?

With this art installation I want to shine the light on the dark side of American Football. One part of this is 'CTE' (Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy), a degenerative brain disease, found in athletes, military veterans, and others with a history of repetitive brain trauma. In the last 15 years, American Football players in particular have been known to have this disease, that can only be diagnosed after death by brain tissue analysis.

The main reason for this is of course the violent character of the sport itself. They use their head as a weapon, just like a ram uses it to fight or a woodpecker uses it to cut a hole in a tree. The only thing is, humans are physiologically not made for this. The countless concussions are a clear indicator of this.

Constant (peer) pressure and the general attitude that team doctors have to keep the players up-and-running (at all costs) only increases the risk of brain injury. 

Possible symptoms of CTE include: memory loss, confusion, impaired judgment, paranoia, impulse control problems, aggression, depression (suicide), and eventually progressive dementia.

To me, the interesting thing about this situation is not the way the NFL is dealing with it. By paying hundreds of former players millions of dollars to prevent further lawsuits. I think it's more interesting to see how the American society is treating their (former) heroes.

It's as if as long the players can play (and entertain the crowd) they are Gods. But once these players need the society or their community for help (psychological or physical) they turn their backs to them.

With this work I wanted to visualize both the good side of American football. The glamour, the fame, team spirit. But also the dark side that society would rather ignore: the many injuries, the brain damage, the domestic violence , the suicides...

That's why one side of the helmet is kept clean and shiny, while the other side is destroyed.

I specifically asked to do the show around this topic because it's a topic in the US.

The Impact 

Consider the Art World as a ladder. Two and half years ago I started at the bottom of it. One year later I had my paintings in cities like Los Angeles, Paris, Brussels, New York and Mexico City. Sounds good, right? I agree! But as an ambitious artist I want more. The last thing I want is to be a one-trick-pony. That's why I took the risk to invest in other projects as well. Projects that may not be as accessible or appreciated as the letter paintings, but focus more on what I want to express as an artist. That's why this opportunity is so interesting. It gives me the chance to show people the artistic direction that I want to go in. And it's not just anywhere! It's in New York: one of thé most important art cities in the World. For that reason alone, I should already go. There's also the opportunity to meet local collectors and other artists.

On top, I will be able to add a New York (solo)show to my portfolio. Which would increase my chances in the future to work with other galleries. 

How much do I need?

Besides my own money that I invest, I need $6.000 to cover the rest of the costs of this project. 

This is a breakdown of my Funding plan

  • 32 NFL helmets: $4.000
  • Production: $1.500
  • Marketing & Promo: $500
  • Photography: €250

Other Ways You Can Help

I know of course that not everybody can contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Feel free to get the word out and make some noise about my project. 
  • Sharing is caring. The more people know about this project, the better.
  • If you know any people, or former NFL players, in New York that might be interested in visiting the show, please let them know.
story_txt:
What is the show about?
With this art installation I want to shine the light on the dark side of American Football. One part of this is 'CTE' (Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy), a degenerative brain disease, found in athletes, military veterans, and others with a history of repetitive brain trauma. In the last 15 years, American Football players in particular have been known to have this disease, that can only be diagnosed after death by brain tissue analysis.
The main reason for this is of course the violent character of the sport itself. They use their head as a weapon, just like a ram uses it to fight or a woodpecker uses it to cut a hole in a tree. The only thing is, humans are physiologically not made for this. The countless concussions are a clear indicator of this.
Constant (peer) pressure and the general attitude that team doctors have to keep the players up-and-running (at all costs) only increases the risk of brain injury. 
Possible symptoms of CTE include: memory loss, confusion, impaired judgment, paranoia, impulse control problems, aggression, depression (suicide), and eventually progressive dementia.
To me, the interesting thing about this situation is not the way the NFL is dealing with it. By paying hundreds of former players millions of dollars to prevent further lawsuits. I think it's more interesting to see how the American society is treating their (former) heroes.
It's as if as long the players can play (and entertain the crowd) they are Gods. But once these players need the society or their community for help (psychological or physical) they turn their backs to them.
With this work I wanted to visualize both the good side of American football. The glamour, the fame, team spirit. But also the dark side that society would rather ignore: the many injuries, the brain damage, the domestic violence , the suicides...
That's why one side of the helmet is kept clean and shiny, while the other side is destroyed.
I specifically asked to do the show around this topic because it's a topic in the US.
The Impact 
Consider the Art World as a ladder. Two and half years ago I started at the bottom of it. One year later I had my paintings in cities like Los Angeles, Paris, Brussels, New York and Mexico City. Sounds good, right? I agree! But as an ambitious artist I want more. The last thing I want is to be a one-trick-pony. That's why I took the risk to invest in other projects as well. Projects that may not be as accessible or appreciated as the letter paintings, but focus more on what I want to express as an artist. That's why this opportunity is so interesting. It gives me the chance to show people the artistic direction that I want to go in. And it's not just anywhere! It's in New York: one of thé most important art cities in the World. For that reason alone, I should already go. There's also the opportunity to meet local collectors and other artists.
On top, I will be able to add a New York (solo)show to my portfolio. Which would increase my chances in the future to work with other galleries. 
How much do I need?

Besides my own money that I invest, I need $6.000 to cover the rest of the costs of this project. 
This is a breakdown of my Funding plan

32 NFL helmets: $4.000
Production: $1.500
Marketing & Promo: $500
Photography: €250

Other Ways You Can Help

I know of course that not everybody can contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Feel free to get the word out and make some noise about my project. 
Sharing is caring. The more people know about this project, the better.
If you know any people, or former NFL players, in New York that might be interested in visiting the show, please let them know.

story:
What is Blue One, Pink One?

Blue one, Pink One is a minimalistic approach introducing children to fashion, creativity, and self discovery with the intention of igniting wee inspiration.

Through this quarterly publication, we hope to create an outlet for families to bond together and inspire one another.  Our primary goal is to ensure that it is comprehensible to even the smallest and freshest of readers but also beloved by their parents.  As such, our publication is dedicated FIRSTLY, however not exclusively, to children.  It is meant to be shared by families, allowing them to read together and be together.

We hope to encourage and facilitate a growing passion in our little ones for reading. We want them to get the issue in their chubby little hands and coo and point and flip from page to page and be inspired to write a piece on superheroes and tell you a story about hippos and take photos of the world around them and go to their closets and pick out something original and speak up in their classes and paint a masterpiece and remember to tell their daddy when he looks handsome or their mother looks lovely. We want the horizon of books before them at the library to suddenly seem surmountable and for reading to be one of your family's favorite past time, if it isn't already.

Secondly, we want to teach our children that it's more than OK to be exactly themselves; that they have nothing to apologize for and no one to answer to for simply being who they are. We want them to feel free to pursue what inspires their little minds and souls. We  want them to see other children and other families around the globe and relate to their feelings and tastes and lifestyles. Our children sometimes have such a small pool to swim in - so few peers to connect with - that it can be very difficult to feel understood and accepted. 

As adults, we also search for ways to connect, to feel understood and accepted, to be inspired by someone like-minded through blogs, magazines, and websites.  This need is shared by our children.

Lastly, we believe our children have so much to teach US. There is so much we forget to indulge, nurture, and engage within them. They are so much more INFINITELY creative than we. They are born without inhibition or worry that they are coloring outside the lines. They are sincerely bold. We hope this publication gives rise to many families communicating on a deeper, more elemental, and more genuine level. 

We believe this publication will help us to remember, as parents, to slow down, unplug, and put aside everything else to wile away the hours every now and again with the greatest friends and teachers we will ever know.


What does it look like?

(Note:  the pictured copies were not printed professionally and are not reflective of the intended quality of the final product.)

Each issue is 15" x 22" unfolded and 15" x 11" folded.  It is printed on nice, thick, post-consumer 70# uncoated paper, with a stunning four color process ink.  There is a 30" x 22" perforated tear out at the centerfold.  All 28 pages, (including covers) are packed with beautiful imagery and inspiring content.

Within our issues, you can expect the following:

- Articles dictated or hand written by children on topics ranging from robots to music to fashion to bullying to favorite places and things and people

- A page dedicated to a roll of disposable camera film shots taken entirely by a child and submitted by reader families

- A quality printed centerfold art print poster to color or paint and frame as well as full page prints throughout


- Crafts and project tutorials to do together

- A stunning editorial fashion spread


- Stories and fairytales hand written by a child or parent and ENTIRELY dictated or written by a child, featuring several hand drawn images rather than words in each sentence (this enables parents and children to read together, as the parent can point to the image and the child can name it as they read)

- Interviews formed and conducted by children

- Reviews of products, places, music, foods, apps, etc., written by children

- Secret codes and games

- Interactive elements on nearly every page

- Beautiful photography 

- Recipes to make together with your little ones and recipes for a date night at home

- Features on Inspiring families around the globe

- Articles written by parents about their sartorial choices and their experiences as a parent

- Tips on maintaining your sense of child-like wonder


What we need:

We will need $17,736.00 to cover the following expenses:

- printing

- shipping 

- legal fees

- indiegogo fee

- music licensing fee

If you would like a more specific breakdown of costs, please refer to the second video (below.)


Other ways to Help:

Please share this link and video with your friends, family, co-workers, and people you love.  Spread the word and let's all get this zine to print!  If you or someone you know is talented and creative in any way, send them to us!  Visit our website for more information and be sure to add us on Instagram, too!


Here is another video we created with additional information including why we started, who we are, the allocation of funding, etc.  Also- you get to hear a three year old attempt to say the word "publication.")



blue one, pink one website

blue one, pink one instagram

story:
In the Summer of 2013 I had the unique pleasure of encountering one of the most paradigm shattering beings I have ever met: Mata Amritanandamayi, commonly known as Amma (mother) or the hugging saint. Amma is a world renowned Indian, activist and spiritual powerhouse, revered by her followers as a guru and a saint.

When I went to receive Darshan (an embrace or hug and chanting prayer), at a gathering in a hotel near the LAX airport in Los Angeles that June, I expected to experience a warm radiant and motherly love, after all “Amma” means “Mother” and her gimmick is hugging people as a kind of blessing or prayer (Darshan - a Sanskrit word meaning “to see” the divine). When I actually nelt before her and she embraced me and started to kind of murmur a chant in a language I did not know: It was almost terrifying, awe inspiring. She became a profound and deadly serious and piercing samurai, a Goddess with the power of the universe behind her, with the presence of an intensely focused general of war during the last battle, inspiring me to surrender my life for a greater purpose, to be direct and serious about my work in this world. It was as if she was telling me to get to the point of my life and really do what I came here to do, to raise the vibration and devote myself to the expression of the benevolent currents circulating through the universe and to have the compassion to be with human pain and suffering, in myself and others.

She’s the least “person like” person I have ever encountered, her tiny little round form seems not much more than the empty shell of a cicada - a localized point of reference for an immense force or divine presence that could seemingly tear her apart at the seams at any moment. It’s almost not accurate to call her human. There is almost no “person” left in her, any fibers of ego seem to have been completely obliterated and she is transmitting something of great power and intensity, both subtle and infinite. This was one of the most awesome and profound things that has ever happened to me. It is with me everyday when I sit on my cushion and close my eyes to meditate, and this is why I wish to do this painting.

I am in the process of developing a large scale painting of Amma. This is the first of 2 studies to prep for the painting, which you will receive based on your funding level. $50 for the first study $200 for the second study and  $250 for the third study. Your funding will help me pay for a large scale canvas on which to do the final painting (roughly 96" x 80.5"), Paint supplies: oil ground, paint, medium, solvent, brushes etc., as well as the time, energy and supplies invested in the studies themselves. Thanks for your support!

A portion of the profit from the sale of the final painting will be donated to Amma’s Charity organization, which provides food, housing and schooling to thousands throughout the world.

to find out more about Amma go to: http://amma.org/

and: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mata_Amritanandamayi

story:
WE'RE BACK! 

The Finest: A G.I. Joe Costume Club is thrilled to partner with the United Service Organizations (USO) for the second annual Girls of the Finest charity calendar!

Last year’s campaign was a huge success, and it demonstrated to the world just how powerful the G.I. Joe fan community is when it comes to raising money for veteran and military-related organizations. Following last year’s success, we are absolutely determined to surpass that success this year!

So here's the deal: 

As you know by now, the Girls of the Finest charity calendar is no ordinary pin-up calendar. All your favorite female characters (plus a few twists) will be portrayed here - 12 months of our amazing female costumers photographed exclusively for this calendar! 

As passionate as we are about G.I. Joe, we also know a good cause when we see one. The Finest is honored for the opportunity to partner with the USO, a nonprofit organization that has supported America’s troops and their families since 1941. One hundred percent of the net proceeds earned from this campaign will go to the USO.

This year’s cause is near and dear to our hearts. A significant portion of Finest members are active duty troops and veterans. Many of our own members and their families have directly benefited from the USO over the years, so being able to partner with this historic organization and give something back is an amazing opportunity!

What better way to come together as a fan community and support the Real American Heroes of the U.S. military and their families!

We Need YOU!

As excited as we are about this project, we can't do it without YOU. Only through your donations will this calendar happen. Your contribution of $5 or more will allow us to:

• Compile all the calendar photography

• Design and produce the calendar and all associated perks

• Pay for printing and shipping costs of the calendar and perks

Also, we will be creating EXCLUSIVE content for this campaign that will only be available to those who donate here, including Girls of The Finest trading cards, postcards, patches, t-shirts and perhaps a few surprises!!! Just like last year, these will only be produced in limited quantities and once they're gone, that's it!

Everyone who donates $5 or more will receive an exclusive Girls of The Finest item. Anyone donating $25 or more will receive the calendar PLUS exclusive items! (See perks on the right for a complete list)

How to Get Involved

Donating funds is the #1 way to get involved but if you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! We need everyone to help spread the word and make some noise about our campaign. Share our link on Facebook, Twitter or other social media. Let other G.I. Joe fans know what we're doing and use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word. Harness the power of the Internet to help us achieve our goal with the USO! 

Get involved however you can - all help is appreciated!

* NOTE: We are happy to ship calendars and perks anywhere in the world! If you are in Canada, please add $7 to your donation to cover shipping. If you are outside North America, please email us with your location and we will let you know what additional shipping charges may apply.

The Impact You Make

The more funds we collect, the more funds will be going to the USO and to military personnel and families who need our help!  We want to be able to help out the men and women who sacrifice so much for us every single day. We value and appreciate their contributions and sacrifices and we want to show them how much they mean to us all.

This is a community call to action! Please join us, and together, let’s make a huge difference in the lives of military personnel and families! 

Thank you!

story:
Ceramic Art Student Association has partnered with Kelly Memorial Food Pantry 

  • CASA is a student driven organization at the University of Texas El Paso
  • We realize that there is a food insecurity crisis happening in El Paso and we have the creative drive and skill as artists to do something about it.

We have organized Panza Llena, Corazon Contento : A Ceramics Sale To Fight Hunger. Our goal is to raise over $10,000

  • We have based this number on what the cost of food is every month at Kelly Memorial Food Pantry.
  • Kelly Memorial Food Pantry serves all of El Paso county.
  • All funds will be donated to Kelly Memorial Food Pantry.

The Impact 

  • Hunger is a global crisis and El Paso is facing this crisis as well.
  • According to the El Pasoans Fighting Hunger 2014 survey, 3000 households are served by food pantries every week in El Paso.
  • Kelly Memorial Food Pantry serves 5,000 clients every month, that translates to over 15,000 family members a month.
  • By donating you will be participating in the Fight Against Hunger on a local level.

Risks & Challenges

CASA members are hard at work making one of a kind ceramics to sell at Panza Llena, Corazón Contento. However, we know not everyone will be able to attend the sale and still want to participate in the fight against hunger. 

  • We need all the support we can get to reach our $10,000 goal.
  • If we don't reach our goal through the sale of our pots, we hope that the donations we receive here will help us reach $10,000.

There Are Two Ways You Can Help

  • You can attend the Panza Llena, Corazón Contento Ceramics Sale December 6th at Hillside Coffee and Donut Co. 
  • Donate to our Indiegogo Campaign and share about it with all your friends!

story:
Short Summary

"Life as art and art as work and work as play." Reverend Jesse Malmed

August 1-12th, 2016 in Billings will be the site of a creative exchange with local and visiting artists. Drawing on shared themes, collaborators will experiment to innovate contemporary storytelling and invite the public to a new kind of hybrid art experience. 

No tickets sales

A different approach to the traditional 'pay at the door' transaction, this campaign serves as a way to fund the project beyond proper ticket sales. Although you're welcome to donate at the door or even after the show if that's more convenient. 

Similar to a gallery style show, In the Ever Now has components for site specific and installation based experiences. A mix of visual art, interactive storytelling, and performance art.

Contributions to this campaign are the tickets. $10, $20, $30 it all adds up and we are appreciative of whatever denomination you can send our way.

What We Need & What You Get

Transparency in what artists do to bring a project to the public often helps in advocacy. It allows a 'peak behind the curtain' of what it takes to put a performance project together. Collectively, we discussed the overall cost of the project and came up with the sum total of $3000. 

Costs will include: Travel, Artwalk registration, performance space rental, rehearsal space rental, catering, print material and the many family style meals we'll likely be cooking and sharing as we spend two weeks together on this project.

The show itself will span two weekends. Friday August 5th during Artwalk as well as the following weekend Friday August 12th. You will get an opportunity to see new work previewed by each of the artists and interact with some of the pieces: plus chat, drink wine, and enjoy a Friday night among artists and friends.

The Impact

As a growing community, Billings is building strong support for art in many genres, performance art included. Eliot Gray Fisher and Erica Gionfriddo, of ARCOS Dance Company, have visited Billings several times and love the people, the atmosphere, and the artists willing to take risks and equally the audiences interested in experiencing those risks. 
"We’d love to bring the company here and have been inspired by our new friends in the area. We decided to create this project as a way to deepen our relationship to Billings, to our craft, and to each other as innovative artists." ~Erica Gionfriddo
Other Ways You Can Help

Share the word about this show with the Billings community. Share this campaign with those you think would find value in helping. Follow the event on Facebook. Attend the show. Above all, go make art. Get to work. Go play.

story:
FJORD is an artist-run exhibition space located in Philadelphia, PA. Since our founding in 2012, we have been dedicated to offering an outlet for alternative discourse and practice in contemporary art. We need your help relocating the gallery to a new and improved central location! Here's why:

FJORD operates as an artist-run space because of the freedom it affords us. Functioning as a non-commercial entity gives us the flexibility and independence to display exciting, challenging, and venturous work free of commercial pressures and limitations. 

While membership fees and various fundraising strategies will contribute to maintaining our new gallery space, we need your help to make the move to a more accessible building and to restructure our organization to become sustainable for the future of FJORD. 

The funds raised from this campaign will be used to secure the new space located in the Crane Arts Building on N. American Street in Philadelphia, PA. We will also be allocating portions of the funds raised to hire a grant writer, provide more support for exhibiting artists, and facilitate more extensive programming than what was previously possible.

                                                   

February 2014, FJORD hosted Rebekah Callaghan, Monica Amor and Rubens Ghenov to discuss the QUALIA show.  

While 2419 Frankford Ave. will certainly be missed, we couldn't be more excited about the opportunities to grow FJORD. Here's what we're looking forward to with our re-launch:

    • Central location providing easier access to the gallery 

    • More square feet for artwork, performances, and events

    • Six-week long exhibitions instead of four

    • Potential to build partnerships within Crane Arts and beyond

    • Greater exposure for the artists who exhibit at FJORD

    • Expanded gallery hours

    • Ability to host and participate in auxiliary events


           

Our mission from the beginning has been to:

  • provide an exhibition space for local and international artists at all points in their career.

  • organize multidisciplinary exhibitions, artist-curated projects, film screenings, and community events

  • foster alternative, experimental, and marginalized practices and discourses within the artist-run model

During the four years that Fjord has been open, we have been lucky enough to work with over 300 artists, both national and international, on over 30 exhibitions. As artist members we see the curatorial projects that take place both inside and outside the walls of FJORD as extensions of our studio practices and the practices of the artist-curators whom we support. As such, we constantly seek out new curatorial opportunities and collaborations that allow us to become engaged with a larger community of artists. With your support we will be able to do more work like this in the future. Here's a selection of projects we are proud to have worked on over the last few years:

  • Artist Run, Satellite Art Show, Miami Art Week

  • Mechanical Turk - a crowd-sourced exhibition in Memorial Hall at RISD, followed by a talk about the founding of FJORD

  • CITYWIDE, a collaborative two-part exhibition with Philadelphia artist-run space, Tiger Strikes Asteroid

FJORD has also collectively given talks and studio visits at regional universities, hosted local student groups, held artist talks, and spoken on local arts panels.

                                

                                         Fall 2014, Fjord speaks at Ursinus College

Here is a selection of artists who have exhibited at FJORD:
Alex Da Corte
Angela Dufresne

Ted Gahl

Jackie Gendel

Joseph Grigely 

Christopher K. Ho

Elina Brotherus

Vera Iliatova

Dona Nelson

Michael Robinson

Lisa Sanditz

Kyle Staver

Craig Taylor

Roger White

Kevin Zucker

Molly Zuckerman-Hartung


We want to continue to explore the possibilities of an artist-run space in Philadelphia, and with your help we can do that. Check out the perks of donating!

story:
We are a group of 45 undergraduate BA (Hons) Photography students in our final year of study raising money in order to hold a graduate exhibition showcasing our work in London. The exhibition is an integral part of the Major Project unit within our degree course. It provides us with professional networking opportunities with current artistic practitioners, in addition to the transferable skills required for future career aspirations. 

We are raising all of the funds for this exhibition, and while the cost of such a logistically complex event is considerable, the standard to which we intend to achieve for the show is equally high, estimating the overall budget at £30,000. We would be extremely grateful for any donations you could make to help us achieve our target.

The Show

FERAL is a graduation exhibition showcasing the work of 130 BA(Hons) students from the Photography, Fine Art and Illustration courses at the Arts University College at Bournemouth. The exhibition will be held within the FREE RANGE series of exhibitions at The Old Truman Brewery, Brick Lane, London from July 5 - 9 2012.

The Brick Lane area is a prestigious and creative location, home to artists, musicians and graphic designers, making it a hub of the artistic community in the East End of London. Close to the financial district, these two areas will form part of our target audience, as well as providing a contemporary presentation of Bournemouth’s emerging creative practitioners for the public.

Our Course

The BA (Hons) Photography Course at the Arts University College at Bournemouth promotes contemporary and experimental work in the medium of photography and has an international reputation, producing important photographers such as fashion photographer Nick Knight OBE and Turner Prize winner Wolfgang Tillmans

Charitable Status

The Arts University College at Bournemouth is an Exempt Charity. The Further and Higher Education Act 1992 states under Schedule 8, section 69 that any further education corporation is an Exempt Charity. An Exempt Charity does not have a registration number and does not have to report to and supply accounts to the Charity Commission. Proof that a college is a further education corporation can be found in the Government Statutory Instrument 2034; both the Further and Higher Education Act 1992 and the Government Statutory Instrument 2034 can be obtained from HMSO.

Thank you, and if you wouldn't mind, please share this page with your friends.

story:
Short Summary

We are a camp of artists, chefs, caterers, DJs and mixologists who have come together to create all the best of Fire and Ice for Burning Flipside. We will bring the artistic talents we have exhibited around the world to sculpt ice in performance for our fellow Flipizens. We will create a DJ stand out of Ice for our talented DJs to spin their fine tunes on. Our fabulous shot ladies will pour elixers over special Ice shot slides to the delight of all and we will provide our World Famous Flamethrower Pizza for our guests enjoyment.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to provide ice blocks for sculptures and gas for the freezer truck to keep our sculpting medium sub zero until performance time. By helping to fund these items you may enjoy perks ranging from our eternal gratitude to a steak dinner cooked by our award winning Chef/Sculptor in the company of the Fire and Ice camp. See our website to view some of the amazing works created by our Master Ice Artist. www.iceworkshouston.com

The Impact

This is our second year for Fire and Ice camp at Burning Flipside and we intend to be a positive addition to the community by exhibiting the burning principles and radically adding to the event. Your support will help us attain these goals.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribute if you can and receive one of our cool perks. If you are unable to contribute, please help let others know about our campaign, or just share a positive thought with some one while thinking of us. Enrich your life in unexpected ways and share your experiences. Namaste.

story:
While working as a field organizer for Barack Obama's 2008 Presidential Campaign it struck me that there was a side of campaigning that is never known until you live it. Our staff was often lauded for our close-knitted-ness, our tenacity, and our dedication. The behind-the-scenes story only reinforces this perception.

Days seemed like weeks and if someone had a desk next to yours then there was a 90% chance that they would become your best friend before the first coffee break was over. And there were moments that illustrated all of this. I began capturing these - just for posterity's sake in my sketchbook. As the moments added up and interest in how this collection of young kids with (largely) no prior experience pulled off an amazing electoral victory began building, I began to see these moments coalescing to tell a greater story.

A collection of 600 drawings that illustrate what it was really like.

The heartache, the unbelievable stress, and the moments when despite everything you laugh for half an hour because someone screwed up and a sex hotline number was printed on a state-wide absentee mailer. This is what campaign life is about: the moments.

The specifics are my own, yet my story is everyone's story on this campaign. The incredibly inspiring call to service that prompted me to hop a bus to New Hampshire, driving from Ohio to Mississippi with just a backpack to my name, and working with the smartest people I'll ever know.

After the 2008 campaign I intended to return to my original day job: working as an artist. Yet, as anyone involved in electoral campaigns can tell you, the industry tends to pull you right back in. Soon enough, I found myself working for OFA again, this time in Florida.

I stayed on through the 2012 cycle, working as a Regional Field Director in the biggest swing state in the country. I found myself once again capturing with those individual moments that continued to tell a larger story.

But it also became a story about change, ironically. The experience in 2012 was quite different than that of 2008. No longer was I inexperienced, soley hope-driven, or naive. The Obama Generation of campaign staff quite frankly had grown up.

The journey is equal parts inspiring and grueling. Its about hope, but at the same time its about the jadedness we all found ourselves saddled with at different points. About victory and defeat. The highs and the lows. And most importantly, the how and the why of a group of young staffers who came together twice to change the world.

There are 300 drawings from the 2008 election juxtaposed with 300 from the 2012 election. The theme of change carries over into the artwork itself, as I grew a great deal during my work on this project.

Many books will be written that tell the story of the candidate, or the candidate's top advisors. But we were the foot soldiers right on the frontline. And in many states, we were the margin of victory.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

The project will be released in the form of two E-Books. If I raise enough money, I will be making an effort to also produce hard copies of the book as well. The 2008 E-Book will be released in January of 2013. The 2012 E-Book will be released in July of 2013, due to the time it will take to complete the artwork. If you donate to receive both E-Books, you will receive the first one in January and the second seperately.

If you pledge to receive a print or original drawing, you will receive access to a doc to choose which one you would like. You can choose one of the drawings already completed, or monitor the doc as new drawings are added from 2012, if you have more interest in that cycle.

story:
My name is Elena Mazzi and I am an Italian artist. My work deals with the relationship between man and the environment in which he/she lives and with which he must reckon on a daily basis. This analysis, which often follows an anthropological approach, investigates and documents an identity which is at the same time personal and collective, relating to a specific territory, and giving rise to forms of exchange and transformation. 

Reflecting Venice is my last art project. This is the result of a collaboration Isomorph, research enterprise directed by professor and scientist Hans Grassmann (Udine University), that works in the field of experimental physics to project new systems of energy development.

Reflecting Venice is a project that investigates the possibility of responding to last year’s increase of environmental issues affecting Venice. Through the application of an interdisciplinary methodology, Reflecting Venice explores technological innovation and its implications. 

The interdisciplinary experimentation promoted by Reflecting Venice is intended as a tool to create a responsible artistic practice.This includes deeper analysis of environmental issues in the region along with the intention of understanding and ultimately remedying them through the medium of art.

The starting point is a specific area of Venetian territory: Murano island. Known on a global scale for its hand-made glass production, today the island is facing a gradual transformation. While it remains a precious historical and cultural heritage, it conversely displays a fetishized representation of international mass tourism.

Reflecting Venice focuses the attention on the peculiar technique of engraving on mirrors, a typical local craft tradition that is rapidly being replaced by simpler glass items, easy to sell to tourists. My intervention consists in re-elaborating the flower decorative elements typical from the 17th and 18th centuries.These will be been substituted with the iconography of flowers and plants from Venice Lagoon, disappearing because of the pollution.

By combining this decoration with issues of environmental disease, the project refers to the prototype of Linear Mirror II, experimented by physicist Hans Grassmann at Udine University, which provides solar thermal energy at high temperatures also in winter, by using normal mirrors that reflect the solar light, referring to Archimeds' theory of reflecting mirrors. 

The new drawings I am experimenting with Murano’s masters on mirrors' production, will be directly addressed and portrayed on the Linear Mirror II.

The artwork, consisting in a functional installation, will be exhibited during the next Venice Architecture Biennale (June-August 2014), as a collateral event, and then will move to Stockholm for Fittja Biennal (September-November 2014).

The project has been supported by Botkyrka Konsthall in Stockholm, Isomorph, Fondazione Bevilacqua La Masa Atelier programme, and Società di Mutuo Soccorso, Carpentieri e Calafati in Venice, but it still needs a contribution to be finalized. 

The money needed are intended only for production costs.

Here the blog of the project: http://reflectingvenice.tumblr.com/

About me:

I was born in 1984 in Reggio Emilia (Italy). I received my BFA in 2007 in History of Art from Siena University, and my MFA in 2011 in Visual Art from IUAV, Venice University. I spent a semester as guest student at Royal Academy of Art (Konsthögskolan) of Stockholm. I have been included in solo and collective international exhibitions.  In 2011 I attended Future Farmers A.I.R., supported by G.A.I. Italian prize for young Italian artists abroad. In 2012 I won Fondazione Lerici grant for an exhibition at the Italian Institute of Culture in Stockholm, and I have been selected for the annual workshop with Tim Rollins & K.O.S. at Fondazione Spinola Banna in Turin. In 2013 I have been invited to participate in Dolomiti contemporanee project and I was the winner of one-year studio space at Bevilacqua La Masa Foundation in Venice. I was one of the finalists at Celeste Prize and in 2014 I have been selected for EGE-European glass experience travelling exhibition. My work is always been supported by public grants, here you can check out my website and my portfolio

www.elenamazzi.com



--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ITALIANO

Mi chiamo Elena Mazzi e sono un'artista italiana. Il mio lavoro indaga il rapporto tra l'uomo e l'ambiente ad esso circostante, nel quale vive e con il quale si confronta ogni giorno. Attraverso un approccio di tipo antropologico metto in pratica un processo finalizzato alla comprensione e all’ analisi di un’identità, al contempo personale e collettiva, legata ad uno specifico territorio.

Reflecting Venice è il mio ultimo lavoro artistico. Esso è frutto di una collaborazione con l’impresa di ricerca Isomorph, diretta dal professor Hans Grassmann (Università di Udine), che opera nel campo della fisica sperimentale per la progettazione di nuovi sistemi di sviluppo energetico.
Si tratta di un progetto che investiga le possibilità d’intervento sulle problematiche ambientali della città di Venezia, fortemente accentuatesi negli ultimi anni. Attraverso una metodologia di lavoro interdisciplinare, Reflecting Venice esplora l’innovazione tecnologica e le sue potenzialità espressive.

La sperimentazione interdisciplinare promossa da Reflecting Venice è intesa come strumento per dar luogo a una pratica artistica responsabile. Questo implica un'analisi più approfondita delle problematiche ambientali locali, allo scopo di proporre una soluzione realistica attraverso il medium artistico.

Punto di partenza del progetto è stato lo studio di un’area specifica del territorio veneziano: l’isola di Murano. Conosciuta su scala globale per la produzione artigianale del vetro, l’intera isola subisce oggi un graduale processo di trasformazione, fino ad apparire luogo delle dicotomie: da una parte, patrimonio culturale e storico, dall’altra, feticcio rappresentativo del turismo di massa internazionale.

Refletting Venice focalizza l’attenzione su una tipica lavorazione artigianale locale che sta oggi scomparendo, per lasciare posto alla produzione di oggettistica più facilmente commerciabile: la decorazione a incisione sugli specchi. In particolare, il mio intervento sarà costituito dalla rielaborazione degli elementi floreali di matrice seicentesca e settecentesca che costituiscono il motivo decorativo più utilizzato nell’incisione degli specchi. Tali elementi verranno sostituiti con la raffigurazione di specie floreali in pericolo della laguna veneziana.

Combinando questa decorazione alle problematiche ambientali locali, il progetto fa riferimento allo Specchio Lineare II, sperimentato appunto dal fisico Hans Grassmann presso l'Università di Udine, che fornisce energia solare ad alte temperature anche in inverno, attraverso una combinazione di normali specchi che riflettono la luce solare riprendendo la teoria di Archimede degli specchi riflettenti.

Le nuove decorazioni floreali, create in collaborazione con i maestri muranesi, saranno realizzate direttamente sugli specchi dello Specchio Lineare II.

L'opera d'arte, che consiste in un'installazione funzionante, sarà esposta all'interno della prossima Biennale d'Architettura di Venezia (Giugno-Agosto 2014) come evento collaterale, e andrà poi a Stoccolma per la Biennale di Fittja (Settembre-Novembre 2014).

Il progetto è supportato da Botrkyrka Konsthall di Stoccolma, Isomorph,programma di Atelier della Fondazione Bevilacqua La Masa e Società di Mutuo Soccorso, Carpentieri e Calafati a Venezia, ma ha ancora bisogno di un contributo per essere portato a termine.

La somma richiesta è intesa solamente per costi di produzione.

Qui il link al blog del progetto: http://reflectingvenice.tumblr.com/

Su di me:

Sono nata nel 1984 a Reggio Emilia, ma vivo e lavoro a Venezia.

Ho studiato Storia dell’Arte presso l’Università di Siena. Nel 2011 mi sono laureata in Arti Visive presso lo IUAV di Venezia. Ho trascorso un periodo di studi all’estero presso la Royal Academy of Art (Konsthögskolan) di Stoccolma. Ho partecipato a diverse mostre collettive e personali internazionali, Nel 2011 ho vinto la borsa Movin’up per un progetto di residenza a San Francisco in collaborazione con il gruppo Future Farmers. Nel 2012 ho vinto una borsa della Fondazione Lerici per una mostra all'Istituto Italiano di Cultura di Stoccolma, e ho partecipato al workshop di Tim Rollins & K.O.S. presso la Fondazione Spinola Banna per l’Arte a Poirino (TO). Nel 2013 sono stata invitata al programma di residenze di Dolomiti contemporanee, e assegnataria di uno studio alla Fondazione Bevilacqua La Masa di Venezia. Sono stata finalista del Premio Celeste, mentre invece nel 2014 sono stata selezionata per il premio-mostra itinerante EGE-European Glass Experience. Il mio lavoro è sempre stato supportato da borse pubbliche, di seguito il link per dare un'occhiata al mio sito web e portfolio

www.elenamazzi.com
story_txt:
My name is Elena Mazzi and I am an Italian artist. My work deals with the relationship between man and the environment in which he/she lives and with which he must reckon on a daily basis. This analysis, which often follows an anthropological approach, investigates and documents an identity which is at the same time personal and collective, relating to a specific territory, and giving rise to forms of exchange and transformation. Reflecting Venice is my last art project. This is the result of a collaboration Isomorph, research enterprise directed by professor and scientist Hans Grassmann (Udine University), that works in the field of experimental physics to project new systems of energy development.Reflecting Venice is a project that investigates the possibility
of responding to last year’s increase of environmental issues
affecting Venice. Through the application of an interdisciplinary methodology, Reflecting Venice explores technological innovation and
its implications. 
The interdisciplinary experimentation promoted by Reflecting Venice
is intended as a tool to create a responsible artistic
practice.This includes deeper analysis of environmental issues in the region along with the intention of understanding
and ultimately remedying them through the medium of art.The starting point is a specific area of Venetian territory: Murano island. Known on a global scale for its hand-made glass production, today the island is facing a gradual transformation.
While it remains a precious historical and cultural heritage, it conversely displays a fetishized representation of
international mass tourism.
Reflecting Venice focuses the attention on the peculiar technique
of engraving on mirrors, a typical local craft tradition
that is rapidly being replaced by simpler glass items, easy
to sell to tourists. My intervention consists in re-elaborating the flower decorative elements typical from the 17th and 18th centuries.These will be been substituted with the iconography of flowers
and plants from Venice Lagoon, disappearing because of
the pollution.
By combining this decoration with issues of environmental disease, the project refers to the prototype of Linear Mirror II, experimented by physicist Hans Grassmann at Udine University, which provides solar thermal energy at high temperatures also in winter, by using normal mirrors that reflect the solar light, referring to Archimeds' theory of reflecting mirrors. The new drawings I am experimenting with Murano’s masters on mirrors' production, will be directly addressed and portrayed
on the Linear Mirror II.
The artwork, consisting in a functional installation, will be exhibited during the next Venice Architecture Biennale (June-August 2014), as a collateral event, and then will move to Stockholm for Fittja Biennal (September-November 2014).The project has been supported by Botkyrka Konsthall in Stockholm, Isomorph, Fondazione Bevilacqua La Masa Atelier programme, and Società di Mutuo Soccorso, Carpentieri e Calafati in Venice, but it still needs a contribution to be finalized. The money needed are intended only for production costs.Here the blog of the project: http://reflectingvenice.tumblr.com/


About me:I was born in 1984 in Reggio Emilia (Italy). I received my BFA in 2007 in History of Art from Siena University, and my MFA in 2011 in Visual Art from IUAV, Venice University. I spent a semester as guest student at Royal Academy of Art (Konsthögskolan) of Stockholm. I have been included in solo and collective international exhibitions.  In 2011 I attended Future Farmers A.I.R., supported by G.A.I. Italian prize for young Italian artists abroad. In 2012 I won Fondazione Lerici grant for an exhibition at the Italian Institute of Culture in Stockholm, and I have been selected for the annual workshop with Tim Rollins & K.O.S. at Fondazione Spinola Banna in Turin. In 2013 I have been invited to participate in Dolomiti contemporanee project and I was the winner of one-year studio space at Bevilacqua La Masa Foundation in Venice. I was one of the finalists at Celeste Prize and in 2014 I have been selected for EGE-European glass experience travelling exhibition. My work is always been supported by public grants, here you can check out my website and my portfoliowww.elenamazzi.com--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ITALIANO

story:
--- deutsche Version unten --- 

ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN

Dear friends, colleagues and supporters,

This campaign is to raise money to fund the production of new work that I'll be creating during a four months road trip up the Australian east coast and a visit to the Ayers Rock region. 

Ever since I first read about Aborigines and their dreamtime stories and mysterious walkabout tradition fifteen years ago, I wanted to learn firsthand about their mythology, spirituality and connection to nature.

In the meantime I have become a photographer and visual artist and am equipped to investigate those themes in a creative way, thereby laying the groundwork for my further artistic development. Along the way of a 4000 km trip from Melbourne to Cairns I'll be collecting stories about Australians and their take on life, spirituality and nature. By taking photographs of people and landscapes I want to create a visual narrative that illustrates the connection between Australians and their land. 

I want to share this experimental exploration with you and take you on an inspirational journey. You can be part of the experience in a variety of ways, i.e. receive postcards from the road, enjoy lengthy travel reports or purchase photographic prints. 

I am looking forward to taking you with me on this journey and sharing the beauty and the wisdom of Oz with you. Thank you for your contribution.

Lots of love, Kristin


BE PART OF THE JOURNEY

I need to raise a minimum of 4000 Euro in four weeks.

80 Percent of the money goes towards the travel costs for the production of new artistic work.
  • 1500 Euro flights + insurance
  • 2000 Euro car + petrol for the 4000km trip
  • 500 Euro cost of film, film development, photo paper etc.
In return, I am offering the following:
  • Creative postcards from the road
  • Lengthy digital travel reports filled with inspiring stories and pictures from the journey
  • A calendar in A3-format for 2017 with new photographs from Australia
  • Portrait commissions for those in the Berlin/Brandenburg area
  • Signed 8x10 inch prints on Kodak Royal matte paper with a quarter inch border on top and sides. All prints come signed with a personal thank you note.     


HELP SPREAD THE WORD!

Whether you can contribute or not, thank you for your support. Please email this campaign to people who might be interested in contributing and collecting my work.  Please also post this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Blog pages. Spreading the word is equally as effective as donating! Thank you.



ABOUT KRISTIN HOELL

Kristin Hoell is a photographer and visual artist based in Berlin, Germany. She received her MA's in Photography from the University of Brighton and the University of Art and Design Halle Burg Giebichenstein. Her work has been exhibited in several group shows in Europe (i.e. Photographers' Gallery London, SIM Gallery Reykjavik, Künstlerhaus 188 Halle/Saale, WhiteBox Munich, Sur La Montagne Berlin). She recently had a solo show at ReTramp Gallery in Berlin.



THANK YOU!

I cannot thank every single one of you who contributed to this campaign enough. You are true magic. I'm looking forward to sharing my new photography work with you. Thanks again! Lots of love, Kristin 


------------------------------------------------------------------------


WORUM GEHT'S?

Liebe Freunde, Kollegen und Unterstützer,

um die Produktion neuer künstlerischer Arbeiten zu finanzieren, die ich während einer viermonatigen Reise entlang der australischen Ostküste und während eines Besuchs der Ayers-Rock-Region herstellen werde, habe ich diese Crowdfunding-Kampagne gestartet.

Seit ich vor fünfzehn Jahren zum ersten Mal von den Aborigines und ihren Traumzeit-Geschichten und mysteriösen Walkabouts gehört habe, wollte ich aus erster Hand mehr über ihre Mythologie, Spiritualität und Verbindung zur Natur erfahren.  

In der Zwischenzeit bin ich Fotografin und visuelle Künstlerin geworden und bin gut darauf vorbereitet, diese Themen auf kreative Weise zu erforschen, um damit auch den Grundstein für meine weitere künstlerische Entwicklung zu legen. Während der 4000 Kilometer langen Reise von Melbourne nach Cairns werde ich Geschichten über Australier und ihre Sicht auf das Leben, Spiritualität und die Natur sammeln. Ich werde Fotografien von Menschen und Landschaften anfertigen, mit denen ich visuell von der Verbindung zwischen Australiern und ihrem Land erzählen möchte. 

Ich möchte meine Erfahrungen gern mit Dir teilen. Du kannst auf verschiedene Art und Weise Anteil an dieser inspirierenden Reise nehmen, z.B. erhalte Postkarten von der Reise, genieße lange Reiseberichte oder kaufe Fotografien.

Ich freue mich sehr darauf, Dich mit auf dieses Abenteuer zu nehmen und die Schönheit und Weisheit von Australien mit Dir zu teilen. Danke für Deine Mitwirkung.

Alles Liebe, Kristin


SEI TEIL DER REISE

Das Kampagnenziel ist, in vier Wochen 4000 Euro zu sammeln.

80 Prozent des Geldes fließt in Reisekosten für die Produktion neuer künstlerischer Arbeiten. 

  • 1500 Euro Flüge + Versicherungen
  • 2000 Euro Van + Benzin für den 4000km-Trip
  • 500 Euro Kosten für Film, Filmentwicklung, Fotopapier etc. 

Im Gegenzug biete ich Folgendes: 

  • Kreative Postkarten von der Reise
  • Ausführliche digitale Reiseberichte voll mit inspirierenden Geschichten und Bildern von der Reise
  • Einen A3-Format-Kalender für 2017 mit neuen Fotografien aus Australien.
  • Porträt-Sessions in Berlin/Brandenburg
  • Signierte 20x30 Zentimeter große Fotoabzüge auf Kodak Royal matt mit zirka 0,5 Zentimeter Rand ums Bild. Alle Fotografien werden mit einer persönlichen Dankeschön-Notiz verschickt.  


BITTE WEITERSAGEN

Egal, ob Du einen Beitrag leisten kannst oder nicht, vielen Dank für Deine Unterstützung. Bitte maile diese Kampagne an Menschen, die daran interessiert sein könnten, die Aktion zu unterstützen oder meine fotografische Arbeit zu sammeln. Bitte poste die Kampagne auch auf Deiner Facebook-/Twitter-/Instagram- oder Blog-Seite. Weitersagen ist so effektiv wie eine finanzielle Unterstützung. Vielen Dank.



ÜBER KRISTIN HOELL

Kristin Hoell ist eine Fotografin und visuelle Künstlerin aus Berlin. Sie hat ihre Master-Abschlüsse in Fotografie von der University of Brighton und der Kunsthochschule Burg Giebichenstein Halle erhalten. Ihre Arbeiten sind europaweit in verschiedenen Gruppenausstellungen gezeigt worden (z.B. Photographers' Gallery London, SIM Gallery Reykjavik, Künstlerhaus 188 Halle/Saale, WhiteBox Munich, Sur La Montagne Berlin). Sie hatte kürzlich eine Einzelausstellung in der ReTramp Galerie in Berlin. 



DANKESCHÖN!

Ich kann Euch nicht genug fürs Unterstützen danken. Ihr seid großartig. Ich freu mich drauf, meine neuen fotografischen Arbeiten als erstes mit Euch zu teilen. Vielen Dank nochmal! Alles Liebe, Kristin

story:
Painting in Light and Darkness

MARTHA Loving is an Artist, Educator, and Art Therapist trained in The Netherlands in Painting Therapy according to methods developed by Liane Collot d’Herbois (1907-1999). Ms. Loving is one of seven women practicing this medical therapy in the USA, having received a diploma from the Goetheanum in Dornach, Switzerland. The artistic AND therapeutic methods developed by Collot d’Herbois work with the Universal Principles of LIGHT, COLOR, and DARKNESS as we see them in Nature.

COLLOT was a Master painter, producing works of art that are beautiful and healing to behold. Most of her works are held in private collections rarely seen by the public.

MS. LOVING has been presented with A GOLDEN OPPORTUNITY to purchase an original Collot veil painting for educational purposes and public exhibitions. The veil painting, “The Rose” was painted in 1982. Your donations will further the cultural education and understanding of this unique approach to art and painting therapy, without which the magnitude of Collot’s work will be lost.

 

THE estimated costs for this project are:

$2,000 is for the purchase of the painting; $500 is for framing the painting with museum glass and quality matting; $350 covers costs of the initial exhibition of “The Rose”; $150 covers costs of printing postcards.

 

THE work with LIGHT, COLOR, and DARKNESS has tremendous applications in the world. Ms. Loving has been working with these principles in both artistic and therapeutics practice for nearly 20 years. She has been exhibiting her work internationally for more than 30 years. The direct effects of working with these principles include major transformations in one’s inner life, bringing balance and harmony to oneself and the world. Contemplating works like “The Rose” brings a healing effect to everyone.

PLEASE help us spread the word about this project! You can use the Indiegogo share tools and like on my “Thinking with the Heart” Facebook page. Thank you!
story_txt:
Painting in Light and Darkness
MARTHA Loving is an Artist, Educator, and Art Therapist trained in The Netherlands in Painting Therapy according to methods developed by Liane Collot d’Herbois (1907-1999). Ms. Loving is one of seven women practicing this medical therapy in the USA, having received a diploma from the Goetheanum in Dornach, Switzerland. The artistic AND therapeutic methods developed by Collot d’Herbois work with the Universal Principles of LIGHT, COLOR, and DARKNESS as we see them in Nature.
COLLOT was a Master painter, producing works of art that are beautiful and healing to behold. Most of her works are held in private collections rarely seen by the public.
MS. LOVING has been presented with A GOLDEN OPPORTUNITY to purchase an original Collot veil painting for educational purposes and public exhibitions. The veil painting, “The Rose” was painted in 1982. Your donations will further the cultural education and understanding of this unique approach to art and painting therapy, without which the magnitude of Collot’s work will be lost.
 
THE estimated costs for this project are:
$2,000 is for the purchase of the painting; $500 is for framing the painting with museum glass and quality matting; $350 covers costs of the initial exhibition of “The Rose”; $150 covers costs of printing postcards.
 
THE work with LIGHT, COLOR, and DARKNESS has tremendous applications in the world. Ms. Loving has been working with these principles in both artistic and therapeutics practice for nearly 20 years. She has been exhibiting her work internationally for more than 30 years. The direct effects of working with these principles include major transformations in one’s inner life, bringing balance and harmony to oneself and the world. Contemplating works like “The Rose” brings a healing effect to everyone.
PLEASE help us spread the word about this project! You can use the Indiegogo share tools and like on my “Thinking with the Heart” Facebook page. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Ingress is a game. A game of virtual chess,  a game of exploration, a game of international intrigue and most importantly a game of social connections.   In this game,  you'll find locations in the world and capture them for your team.  In this project, we not only find the locations, but we make them,  and the virtual status of the in-game location will control the lights and sound of the piece.  Its a feedback loop.  And it is incentive to build some art in the stunning redwoods of Navarro, CA; art controlled by augmented reality. 

We are making a participatory, techno-magical, three dimensional cavernous space, for real.

  • We are Camp Listener: a burner-flavored, cross faction, Ingress art making team
  • We believe that making art is a fundamental engagement that builds community, encourages storytelling, and in the case of this event, it brings some much needed reality to augmented reality.
  • As a contributor, you will help us achieve a wonderful installation, the second in this series, that takes the light that you bring to the art and reminds you of the reciprocity of energies in the game and in our lives.

What We Need & What You Get

  • To make this magic happen: we need approximately 1,200 dollars to avoid significantly taxing our camp team members -- this will only cover the materials, technology, printing, needed tools and services, rewards, fees, and postage. (Personal travel expenses and entry fees will not be covered.)
  • Contributors will receive unique gifts - buttons, patches, jewelry, custom wearables, or even a panel of the art that can be installed at your home, barbecue, or local event/anomaly.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will scale back as needed.  However, we have been trying to be frugal and rely on as much borrowed resources as much as we can.

The Impact

More explanation about our campaign and the difference our contribution will make:

  • What makes this important is the art.  The participatory experience and dialogue it encourages is important.  It's important for folks to have the opportunity to shift their experience and make things and take risks that they might not have had the chance to do otherwise.
  • While this is the second piece in this Ingress series,  these installations have been made by Hapto dating back to 2004 at Burning Man and East Coast Regionals. Most of these projects have been successfully funded by event grants and generous donors.  She will do what she sets out to do and will put forward the best effort with the available resources.   
  • This is the most ambitious piece to date. Over 1000 feet of reflective materials, adhered to nearly invisible fabric.  The floating images are like no other. 

Risks & Challenges

We have lots of experience, but our challenges are primarily in transportation and funding.  We are traveling from Wisconsin, Hawaii, Arizona (and other places) and this gives a challenge or building the piece in advance and getting it from here to there.    We will use the postal service if needed, and have secured staging homes in California to collect the art and needed tools and technology on the West coast.  We will try for alternatives if we can, as we are scrappy, flexible and very determined.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of your are just as broke as we are, and any sharing, or asks you can make on our behalf are helpful.   Also if you are in the Milwaukee area, feel free to ping Hapto, as there might be opportunities to help make the art, or if you would like to bring this art to an event near you!  If you are interested in joining us and helping on site in Northern California, please sign up!  http://events.ingress.com/magnus/osiris/navarro

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Ashley DeHoyos, an artist and curator from Houston, TX currently living in Baltimore, MD. For the past year-and-a-half, I have been researching and developing TRACES, Ni de aquí, Ni de allá (neither here, nor there), a curatorial thesis project that examines identity and cultural issues relating to Latin American heritage and the influence of Western culture. 

TRACES will open on April 1, 2016 at Area 405 (405 East Oliver Street, Baltimore, Maryland) and will run until April 22, 2016. 

Featuring Artist: Krissty Batres, Nicoletta Daríta de la Brown, Gabrielle Velez, René Treviño, Ricardo Vicente Jose Ruiz, Justin Zachary, Irvin Morazan, Edgar Reyes, Jorge Galvan and Ryan Flores. 

What We Need 

Your support is integral to making this project a success. I am working towards a goal of $5000.00, that will allow me to complete the project successfully. While I have been able to secure some funding, I am far from reaching my goal. The funds raised from this campaign will be used to further develop the project and provide support for promotional material, exhibition and installation supplies as well as accessibility resources such as bi-lingual wall text and audio descriptions in the space and website and public programming events that will be open to the public. 

With your donation limited edition items such as tote bags, exhibition posters will be given out for your support. Plus with certain levels of donations your name will be featured on the website, catalogue and marquee wall during the run of the show as proud supporter and sponsor! 

The Impact  

TRACES draws from extensive conversations with artists, curators, friends, and family working and producing artwork in America under the presumed Latin American umbrella. This project challenges 9 artists currently living in Maryland, Virginia, and Texas to create or present work that highlights or eradicates traces of such influences in their own lives. 

Through visual art and performance, TRACES will confront the Eurocentric standards and expectations too often placed on Latin American artists and questions the accepted norms and distorted influence of such standards. By shining light on the emerging Latin American population, TRACES will create needed discourse around the issues relating to cultural essentialism, acculturation, and assimilation.

story:
Short Summary                                                                           CALLING ALL ARTIST AND SUPPORTERS OF ART

THE TEMPLE OF DEVOTION

This years 2013 Saguaro Man Temple needs your help raising the rest of the fund$$$ to build this burnable art for the Arizona Burning Man community! 1000$ of this 2500$ project is already met. I truly believe that we as a community can raise the rest!

What We Need & What You Get 

We the community need 1500 more $$$ to complete this project.

The perks of this project are... To get to interact with it on a most pesonal level which is different for all. They will get a 2013 Saguaro Man Temple sticker. And most important which is priceless for most. THEY GET TO WATCH IT BURN

The Impact

The Temple in pacts the Community on so many different personal levels there are to many words to describe it. If you have ever been to Burning Man Or any of the Regionals ex Saguaro Man then you know how it impacts the community and how much of a valubale and mental aspect it has all that being said thank you all for you help and contributions MUCH LOVE

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has money to contribute but there are other ways to help. 

Spread the word of mouth

Share on networking sights such as facebook, twitter, myspace etc.

Come to Saguaro Man and put your thoughts on it and be a part of it.

story:
I have a great job; I get to show off artists’ books to visitors at Abecedarian Gallery. I show books to people who love and buy them, and I show books to people who don't know anything about them.

Artists' books are so wonderful, I want to show them to everybody, not just people who can visit the gallery . . . . to people  who live in small towns, far away from museums, galleries and universities. If I raise my own funds I can arrange visits at schools, libraries and community centers without administrative headaches like budget cuts or grant applications.

I have a lot of wonderful books to take on the road, I have a roomy car and good packing crates, I have a great assistant who will keep the gallery open while I am away. I have a long list of schools, libraries, community centers and art galleries I want to visit.

Mostly I need money . . .
• for gas
• for lodging
• for extra insurance for the traveling books
• for paying my assistant to work extra hours while I'm away

There are lots of perks to choose from - I can't put pictures in the perk descriptions so I've put some pics here . . . you can also see a list of perks with links/images and descriptions by clicking here. If the link doesn't work - you'll need to manually type in: www.bit.ly/gogoperks



Other perks include
Historic Ephemera from the Rare Book School Book Arts Press
Hand pulled prints from the Women’s Caucus for the Arts Colorado Chapter
A selection of my very own artists’ books never before offered for sale . . .

I chose Indiegogo because of flex-funding (this means that even if I don't reach my goal, I will be able to use whatever funds have been contributed for my project); I'll take as many trips as I can with the money raised.

This also means that you will get your perk no matter what - woohoo!

Trip costs will vary, depending on how far away and how long I need to be away. If I reach my goal of $5000 I estimate being able to take a combination of  5-6 short trips (150 miles away or less) and 3-4 long trips (150-300 miles away). On every trip I should be able to visit more than one school or art center. The more I raise, the more places I'll go.

PPS . . . if you live in Colorado, New Mexico, Wyoming, Nebraska or Utah, send me ideas of places I can go (and who to talk to about scheduling a visit)

story:
Bushwick Art Crit Group (BACG) has assembled a groundbreaking group exhibition showcasing emerging and mid-career Bushwick, Brooklyn-based artists for our inaugural participation at SELECT Art Fair during Art Basel Miami Beach (December 2-7, 2014).

Our exhibition establishes Bushwick as not only the vanguard of contemporary art in New York; but also as a permanent incubation point, where work that will hold a permanent place in the constantly evolving spectrum of art history is created. The artists that represent this contribution are based on three interrelated categories:

1. The subversives. Artists whose work challenges societal convention via art that is politically, sexually, or socially disruptive. Artists to be shown in this first category include: Meryl Meisler, Andrew Cornell Robinson, and Phoenix Lindsey-Hall.

2.) The post feminists. Women whose work delineates an elevated mindset of female empowerment. Women have yet to achieve the parity they enjoy in many traditional industries, and we foresee a pending and rapid market correction in Contemporary art. Artists to be shown in this second category include: Lisa Levy, Alison Brady, Beata Chrzanowska, and Kelsey Shwetz.

3.) The category expanders. Artists who delight in expanding and redefining the conventional parameters of visual art genres and categorization. Artists to be shown in this category include: Thomas Stevenson, Drew Van Diest, Eric Gottshall, and Andrea Wolf.

What Is BACG?

Bushwick Art Crit Group (BACG) is part networking & creative development community and part think-tank for the visual arts in Bushwick. BACG launched in March 2013 with a monthly art crit group where 6-7 artists present their work to gallerists, curators, other artists, and members of the Bushwick community. While the monthly crit group remains at our core, BACG expanded into group exhibitions and art fairs in late 2013 (most recently as a participant at the echo Art Fair in Buffalo, NY) and art panel discussions in 2014.

What Is SELECT Art Fair?

SELECT is a contemporary art fair that features emerging and mid-career artists showcasing cutting-edge art. BACG has been selected as one of 50 exhibiting galleries at SELECT under the newly appointed curatorial direction of Tim Goossens (MoMA PS1).

(Note: BACG team members Christopher Stout, Kelsey Shwetz, and Eric Gottshall have all exhibited work at SELECT Art Fairs in both Miami and New York).

How Will Donations Be Used?

BACG relies on a small, dedicated team to plan, coordinate and execute its programming. To date, BACG has largely been self-funded by its founder. As our ambitions have expanded, we need significant financial support for large-scale programming.

We need your support to make our participation at SELECT Art Fair a huge success. We have assembled a wide variety of unique and interesting perks that we hope appeals to everyone – from limited edition drawings and sketches, to original art work, to exclusive experiences (representative examples of our art-related perks are found in the image Gallery). Please note: BACG is fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas so all donations are fully or partially tax deductible, and you will receive an official receipt for your tax records.

This pie graph illustrates how your donations will be utilized:

Contributions in excess of our funding goal will be allocated to our nascent Artist Film Library, which is an online, searchable film repository containing videos of studio interviews with BACG artists. Through the Artist Film Library, we are creating an archival legacy to document Bushwick's inevitable transformation into one of the most important contemporary art districts in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you’re unable to make a monetary contribution at this time no problem! We’d still very much appreciate your help in the following ways:

> Share our Indiegogo campaign link on your social media.

> Like/follow Bushwick Art Crit Group on Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, and Twitter and keep informed on NEW events via our website

> Are you an artist in or around Bushwick? Attend our crit sessions and learn how to be involved!  

We Thank You For Your Support!

story:
Short Summary

My work has always desired to go against the grain of what today’s society expectations. After being fascinated in photographing alternative and curvy women and men my final project is to expand and narrow down to photographing ‘ageism’ within the fashion and work industries. While having the interest in online blogging the work I produce has made a turn to be mostly digital. Exploring the abstract yet hardly manipulating the image for the rawness of the model. I want to see imperfections and flaws.

I appreciate experimenting using contrasts as an oxymoron. Issues happening internationally stimulate my work. I am fascinated by how people feel uncomfortable when they do something outside of the box. People feel as if they should follow what society has taught them, whether it is wrong or not.

I believe everyone is an equal and no one is more superior to another. Looks are not everything. Although everyone seems to think that youthful and slender gets you anything in the world. Prejudice is everywhere.

I look at movements by Jean Paul Gaultier and Vivienne Westwood as inspiration towards my concepts such as using curvy women on the catwalk or men wearing skirts. Controversial topics brought out visually into the public eye to create debate yet also open ones eyes.


  • My campaign is very important to me because it is an issue we all can relate to wether your age, size, flaws or confidence. We ALL look at advertisements everyday and seeing these flawless tall slender youthful models, we start losing sight of our own confidence because we are constantly trying to "perfect" our image to be on the same pedestal as the photoshopped model.
  • By donating just a small amount towards my project you will help me cast models (they are expensive!) also travel and refreshments to be supplied to them. (As University does not contribute funding towards any project, therefore this platform would be vital to make my concept REAL!)


The Impact

My project will hopefully show to the public that every woman is beautiful and can still be stylish bright and bold and classy, whatever your age, size or flaws!

The more diversity children and teens see, the less discrimination and bullying!


Breakdown Of Costs:

Models: £400

Food for the models: £30

Cost of final photo book printing: £100

Cost of photography portfolio box: £30

Great casting is essential, if I do not reach my goal of £500 your funding will still help towards booking some fantastic models and taking me one step further towards the project I would love to create. 

If you are unable to contribute you can still help by getting the word out about my project on Facebook, Twitter and other social networking sites. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools (:


Please e-mail me if there are any queries at chantroxer@aol.com

or inbox me using my Facebook link! www.facebook.com/chantellerowleyphotography
