story:
Hawaii-Kalender 2016

Hawaii, für viele Inbegriff des Paradieses, vereint einige der schönsten und einzigartigsten Landschaften der Erde. Die Natur in ihrer Vielfalt und Schönheit, umgeben vom rauschenden Meer und stets sommerlichem Wetter, bietet jedem Besucher ein unvergessliches Erlebnis.

Als ich auf einem Hawaii-Trip in diesem Jahr die Inseln Ohau, Kauai und Maui besucht habe, konnte ich einige wunderschöne Aufnahmen mit zurück nach Deutschland bringen. Viel zu schade um auf meinem Computer zu "verstauben". Jeder Reise-Fanatiker, Foto-Liebhaber, Sommer-Fan und jeder weitere Unterstützer ermöglicht den Druck dieses hochwertigen Kalenders mit 12 einmaligen Aufnahmen für das kommende Jahr 2016 - ob als Weihnachtsgeschenk, für die Küche oder das eigene Büro.

Der Kalender

Der Kalender ist in DIN A3 (297 x 420 mm) auf 250 g/qm Papier & Rückpappe aus 400 g/qm gedruckt. Er zeigt 12 Monatsfotos mit dem dazugehörigen Aufnahmeort und ein Titelfoto von Hawaii. 

Folgende Motive findet ihr im Kalender (nicht alle seht ihr im Miniaturformat, ein bisschen Spannung soll schließlich auch dabei sein ;o) ):

  • Januar: Kurz vor einem extrem starken Regenschauer konnte ich dieses Bild vom Strand in Richtung Landesinnere aufnehmen. Es war früher Abend und die Sonne ging schon hinter den Bergen unter, als eine riesige Regenwolke heranzog und den Strand in Weltuntergangsstimmung hüllte.

        

  • Februar: Waikiki Beach bei Nacht. Einzigartiger Strand mit Großstadtfeeling.

  • März: Das erste Bild aus dem Bambus-Dschungel auf Maui zeigt eine junge Bambuspflanze, die sich mit aller Kraft den morgendlichen Sonnenstrahlen entgegenstreckt .
  • April: Wailea Beach auf Maui, einer der schönsten Strände in einem der teuersten Urlaubsgebiete der Erde. Hier reiht sich ein Hotelkomplex an den nächsten.
  • Mai: Ein Haus direkt am Meer, zu sehen vom Lawai Beach auf Kauai. Umgeben von einer lauen Meeresbrise lässt es sich dort bestimmt gut aushalten :)

  • Juni: Ins beschauliche Örtchen Hanalei auf Kauai kommt man an kleinen Feldern vorbei, umgeben von dichtem Wald und hohen Bergen.
  • Juli: Am wenig bekannten Moloaa Beach auf Kaui kann man angeschwemmte Kokosnüsse in einer traumhaften Kulisse finden.
  • August: Vom berüchtigten Kalalau Trail entlang der Nordküste Kauai's sieht man neben springenden Walen ab und zu einsame Boote auf dem offenen Meer kreuzen.
  • September: Der extrem beschwerliche und gefähriche Kalalau Trail belohnt mit wahnsinnig schönen Ausblicken.

  • Oktober: Wandert man entlang der Küste in Wailea auf Maui, ist bei gutem Wetter der kleiner Nordteil der Insel am Horizont zu erkennen.
  • November: Beeindruckend liegt das Bergmassiv im Hintergrund des Meeres, auf dessen Oberfläche sich Surfer tümmeln wie bunte Fische unter ihnen.

  • Dezember: Das zweite Bild aus dem Bambus-Dschungel zeigt das unglaubliche Grün der gigantischen Bambuspflanzen, die sich hoch hinaus in den Himmel erstrecken.

Die Poster

Neben dem Kalender könnt ihr euch auch für eins von drei Postern in Größe 60x34cm entscheiden. Ob für Küche, Wohnstube oder Büro, so hat man immer ein Stück Paradies im Blick :)!

Möchtet ihr mich vielleicht mehr oder weniger unterstützen, stehen noch ein paar weitere Perks zur Verfügung. Aber schaut selbst...

Die Folgen

Die erfolgreiche Finanzierung ermöglicht es mir, meine Fotoausrüstung auszubauen (ich benötige bspw. ein Teleobjektiv für meine Kamera) um für meine nächsten Trips (bevorzugt sub-/tropische Regionen) bestens gerüstet zu sein und ein langjähriges (und momentan noch geheimes) Fotoprojekt starten zu können.


Risiken & Herausforderungen

Sobald die Kampagne abgelaufen ist, werde ich den Druck des Kalenders sowie der anderen Perks umgehend in Auftrag geben. Innerhalb von max. 10 Tagen werden die Kalender, Poster und Postkarten bei mir ankommen, sie werden dann verpackt und an jeden von euch verschickt. Ich setze mir zum Ziel, euch die Kalender und Poster bis spätestens Weihnachten zukommen zu lassen, damit ihr sie auch pünktlich dem Weihnachtsmann überreichen könnt :)!

Ich werde natürlich stets über den aktuellen Versandstatus informieren damit ihr auf dem Laufenden seid. Über Feedback, Kritik und Anregungen eurerseits freue ich mich und hoffe, euren Wünschen entgegen kommen zu können.

Oktober: Wandert man entlang der Küste in Wailea auf Maui, ist bei gutem Wetter der kleiner Nordteil der Insel am Horizont zu erkennen.
November: Beeindruckend liegt das Bergmassiv im Hintergrund des Meeres, auf dessen Oberfläche sich Surfer tümmeln wie bunte Fische unter ihnen. 


Dezember: Das zweite Bild aus dem Bambus-Dschungel zeigt das unglaubliche Grün der gigantischen Bambuspflanzen, die sich hoch hinaus in den Himmel erstrecken.

    
Die Poster
Neben dem Kalender könnt ihr euch auch für eins von drei Postern in Größe 60x34cm entscheiden. Ob für Küche, Wohnstube oder Büro, so hat man immer ein Stück Paradies im Blick :)!
Möchtet ihr mich vielleicht mehr oder weniger unterstützen, stehen noch ein paar weitere Perks zur Verfügung. Aber schaut selbst...
Die Folgen Die erfolgreiche Finanzierung ermöglicht es mir, meine Fotoausrüstung 
auszubauen (ich benötige bspw. ein Teleobjektiv für meine Kamera) um für meine nächsten Trips (bevorzugt sub-/tropische
 Regionen) bestens gerüstet zu sein und ein langjähriges (und momentan noch geheimes) Fotoprojekt starten zu können.   
Risiken & Herausforderungen Sobald die Kampagne abgelaufen ist, werde ich den Druck des Kalenders sowie der anderen Perks umgehend in Auftrag geben. Innerhalb von max. 10 Tagen werden die Kalender, Poster und Postkarten bei mir ankommen, sie werden dann verpackt und an jeden von euch verschickt. Ich setze mir zum Ziel, euch die Kalender und Poster bis spätestens Weihnachten zukommen zu lassen, damit ihr sie auch pünktlich dem Weihnachtsmann überreichen könnt :)!
Ich werde natürlich stets über den aktuellen Versandstatus informieren damit ihr auf dem Laufenden seid. Über Feedback, Kritik und Anregungen eurerseits freue ich mich und hoffe, euren Wünschen entgegen kommen zu können.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Irina Popova. I've been a photographer for now more than 11 years.  Being a photographer means in my case - being a vagabond with a camera, and direct the whole life into the continuous search of visual stories. I am day and night taking and processing images, and now my photo archives contain more than 1 million photos. 

For this book I decided to put together all my photographic and personal experiences and to search for my background: where I come from and what roots connect me to the ground, wherever I go. 

 

More info about the book:

It is a book into which I put there all my soul, all my experiences, all my past and present. It's about me being a Russian - and trying to understand what means to carry a motherland within yourself. It consists of the photos from my photo archives from more than 10 years of being a photographer, travelling all over the country and basically taking photos whenever I can. It was a life transformed into the surface of the images. The text which accompany the book are the personal memories, sometimes funny, sometimes traumatic, but the ones which reflect the connection with the land – the experiences which form our souls. In the course of the work I understood that there is no such a thing as ideological, official patriotism. There are only those small personal things which form our identity. The interior of the kitchen in the parent’s house. The drunken man on the street whom you help to stand up and who tells you nice words.

  • The book is called “If you have a  Secret”. There is a continuation of this phrase -  "Go far away and hide it under the ground”. The concept is based on the children’s game where you hide a treasure under the glass and bury it – in order to rediscover it on the next day… or many years later.
    In the second part of the project I decided to return to my “Secrets” and to revise them. To rediscover my connection with my land – after more than 7 years of living abroad, I will revisit Russia and find, if that modern, changed country resonates with my soul and something Russian in me.
    The design of the book will play with half-pages, folded pages, and texts hidden in between, in order to create a meta-photography, a storytelling in several layers.

 

 

Book specifications: 

Publisher: Dostoevsky Publishing

County of production: the Netherlands. 

Distribution: worldwide

Number of pages: 168 colour photo pages + 64 text pages 

Paper: for photo pages matt photo paper 150 gr, for text pages - ivory matt paper, 80 gr

Cover: hardcover, craft cardboard 

Binding: open spine, bound with thread

Print run: starting with 300, depending on the amount of orders

Language: 2 separate editions: in Russian and in English. 

Other languages are depending on the request. 

 

What we need and what you get

I decided to start a crowdfunding campaign, but in fact, it's a direct pre-order. The book is going to be produced and stappled in my studio in January 2017. In the way of crowdfunding is the only way for me to fund the printing. It's not financed by any publisher, only by the audience who appreciates my work and believes in me. 

By preordering the book you will become the first ones who will get your copies, numbered by first numbers and signed, with nice extras as postcards from the author. It also allows you to get the book at a cheaper cost than from a shelf of a book shop, a website of a retailer or a stand at a fair, because this is the most direct way with a less possible ammount of intermediaries. 

You also have more options - to order prints or other nice extras. 

The stadium of the project readiness

After the first edition success, now I've revisited the texts with a professional English editor, and I've got an idea for a design which you haven't seen before. Now I'm developing this concept together with a graphic designer and a technical specialist from one of the best known typographies for photobooks.

Further steps

On this page, on my blog nodaywithoutapicture.tumblr.com and on a facebook page I'll be sharing every day an image from the project and also images which in the end didn't fit into the book, and the texts from it, so every day you'll get more info about it. 
I'll be informing you about the process of readiness. 
The design is planned to be ready by the end of November. 
The dummy of the second edition will be presented at Lisbon Photobook Festival at the end of November, and also it'll be documented and put online.

The print process is planned to be   in December and be finished in January 2017. The first books will be packed and shipped to you no later than in February 2017. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please consider sharing the camapaign. 
There is a lottery: 5 people who shared the campaign will get a FREE book. 

I started the campaign in the day of my birthday. In this symbolic day of revising the important steps in my life, your order will be the best present and support for me. 
Thanks. 

With love and inspiration, 

Irina Popova

story:
Earth Unforgettable - The Story

Samuel, a gifted artist and dedicated student headed to college last year to pursue his dream of earning a degree in architecture, a huge accomplishment from someone of his economic background. However, due to economic constraints he was forced to drop out after completing a very successful first semester. 

The son of a fisherman from a humble town on the northern coast of Peru, where the average family lives far below the poverty line, Samuel sees these obstacles as challenges rather than hardships. He is more determined than ever to return to school and has identified an opportunity to begin a small business using his artistic skills. 

Earth Unforgettable was born when Samuel's uncle suggested that he paint t-shirts using special wash resistant paint. The town where he lives receives surf tourism and there are very few opportunities for tourists to buy something unique, locally made, and easy to carry home. Although Samuel has been selling his art for the last few years to tourists, it is often difficult for them to travel with the stunning paintings done on drift wood and greatly reduces the demand. By painting on t-shirts he fills a gap in the market and his pilot study, selling his hand painted t-shirts, was wildly successful. 

He is ready to become a serious entrepreneur supporting himself and enabling him to return to school.  Your donation will not only help Samuel get his business off the ground, but will enable him to get back into school and end the cycle of poverty. If you are unable to donate at this time, you can still help by sharing the video and campaign with friends and family!

About the Shirts

The shirts are each hand painted with a unique one-of a kind design by Samuel. The shirts are made of eco-friendly materials and the paint is safe for washing. He is inspired by the ocean and the landscapes of his coastal town.

Tourists with their one of a kind Earth Unforgettable shirts

Support and Business Education

 Lobitosinfo, a local entrepreneurial start-up that supports community endeavors and provides free travel and tourism information, is providing support and business education to Samuel. Together, market research was completed and a detailed business plan was written. He has committed to fulfill his responsibilities enabling him to see profit, re-invest in his business, save for school and help support his family and community.

Samuel working on his Earth Unforgettable business plan

How Your Donation Will Be Used

The funds raised will be used to finish his workshop so he has a secure and clean place to design and paint his Earth Unforgettable shirts and other artistic creations. The town where he lives has a desert climate with high winds causing dust and sand to accumulate hindering progress and the ability for the shirts to dry without being ruined. His workshop needs a roof, concrete floor, finished walls, a door, and windows to be completed. Additionally, the funds will be used to purchase shirts, paint and other necessary materials.

Samuel's future workshop

story:
Short Summary 

What turned into a beer fueled joke, has now turned into reality! Help pay for me to permanently tattoo a vagina onto my skull. Any and all proceeds will be donated to Planned Parenthood. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need at least $1,000 for a bitchin', high-quality vagina tattoo. But wait! There's more!

For a $50 donation, you get a picture of the final product! A vag permanently and forever emblazoned onto my scalp!

For a $100 donation, you'll have access to the live-stream process of this glorious undertaking!

For $1000, your initials can be incorporated into the tattoo!

The Impact

Not only will I have a super cool vagina on my head forever & ever, but I'll also donate every single cent over $1,000 donated to Planned Parenthood. 


Give me your money please.

story:
"Itellect mug" is a ceramic mug that lets you see a temperature of a drink without using a thermometer.

Each of us is familiar with a situation when a desire of having a cup of tea, coffee or hot bouillon turns into unpleasant feelings for us as the drink turns out to be very hot and in a number of cases we can even gravely burn our oral cavity or hurt the tooth enamel, that will lead us or our children to an appointment to the doctor and useless spending of money, but frequently too cold drink won't give us pleasure either.What to do, how to get something you really want? Repeatedly getting in such a situation, I thought that it would be quite good to have a mug that shows the temperature of drinks, but coming around into some shops I couldn't meet my wishes. Everything aforesaid led me to a thought that such a thing could be in demand by people and become a good business for me. Turning over different varients of how it can be done, I came to something I would like to present to you.

For each drink there is its individual temperature, under which it should be drunk to be able to taste it thoroughly. For instance, an optimal temperature of coffee or tea is 50-60 degrees Celsium.This mug will be especially useful for people with highly sensitive teeth. Moreover the scale that shows temperature will be easy to understand for children.

A special scale is put on a ceramic cup to enable to define temperature without using any data unit or any electronics.
Due to it the mug doesn't differ in exploiting from an ordinary one.




How it works

We use special thermochromic paint that react on particular temperatures. Each of the six values of the temperature Fahrenheit or Celsium correspond with the colours of indication.


Referrals program



How Does it Work? 

1. Log into your Indiegogo account or click here to signup for an Indiegogo account if you have not yet already created an account. 
2. Navigate to the Intellect Mug campaign page and click the "link" icon on the left side of the campaign and then paste this link into an email to send to all youre friends. Or click the Facebook, Twitter, or Google Plus icons to share your unique link on your social media accounts. 
3. View your total referral contribution amount by logging into your profile in the upper right and then click "Referrals".

Design

"intellect mug" will be made in 9 different colour varients, so you will be able to choose one that you like most. During the manufacture only high-qualified and certified materials are used.



Production timeline

Packaging


Shipping

Shipping costs are included in the perk prices.

Why Indiegogo

I have decided to launch this project on indiegogo as I think that this platform will let me realize the demand of my idea and present it not only in my country, but to all of you!

Risks & Challenges


At present I have means for buying the necessary equipment and materials. But as I have been saving this money for several years I can't afford spending it in vain. A success of indiegogo campaign will mean that my means will not be spent in vain and my idea is really in demand.

There are many ways to contribute!

Even if you don't have money right now, you can help us turn our campaign into a reality by sharing it with your family and friends. Just click on any of the Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing buttons( up near the video) and let the world know about our awesome project. Thank you!
There are many ways to contribute!

story:
The dazzling monologue, Jackie, from the ever-astounding Elfriede Jelinek will be performed in Beijing in September 2015.

You can effect change, you can bring people together, you can send a message even when battling the oppression of not being allowed to use your words freely. We hope to deliver with this story a moment of transcendence from the concrete, political now that we are constantly bombarded with and wrapped up in.  To convey a message that begins in the depths, so deep that it cannot be touched, and thus any politics will be masked, disguised by ideology, by abstraction, from the prodding eyes of notorious Chinese censorship. The themes are global, the themes are personal, Jackie is in all of us. She speaks to those of us behind the project as our personal heroine, not for any heroic act but for her quiet suffering. We see in this work an opportunity to touch people, the members of our Chinese audience, with something that from the outside would appear so seemingly foreign, but with a specific and local interpretation we transform the cultural barriers from solid to gas, the alchemists of team Jackie.  We open our doors for free to those who will take the time to sit and listen to the quiet tirade that pours out of our character. We want to create an exchange. We do not make a cultural product for consumption. We aim to begin a discussion. Those who come and see, we trust them to let this stream of consciousness wash over them, wash into them, and with the introspection we hope to stir perhaps there will come something, dare we say some answer, creatively and spontaneously achieved for the endless conflicts of the concrete, political now. We trust them, and we trust you, to help us in our project, to make our art real and available and to reify Jackie in Beijing this coming September.

Yours truly,

Team Jackie

story:
Jérémie Bonamant Teboul and Allan Carrasco, two stars of the miniatures scene, are teaming up to produce Rocco, one huge, brute of a miniature. This is your chance to help bring this ambitious project to life.

As aficionados of his work can attest, monsters and orcs are Allan’s specialties. At shows around the world people kept asking him when he’s going to uses his skills to a large, mounted 54 mm fantasy character. The answer was always, when the time and money are available.

FIGONE is a French miniatures company founded by Jérémie in 2009 and dedicated to producing and selling high quality figures for collectors, sculptors and painters. FIGONE has what it takes to make a finished sculpt commercially available.

With Indiegogo and your help to fund this huge, highly anticipated project, Rocco was born.

ROCCO will be the biggest miniature ever produced by FIGONE and the largest ever sculpted by Allan Carrasco.

Rocco will be a large 54mm scale miniature cast in high quality resin, approximately 120 mm high, composed of 16 pieces. 


Here you'll see the final miniature, along with the final concept by artist Bertrand Benoit.

Don’t forget that Allan is an artist and these drawings have served as inspiration rather than a concrete blueprint. He followed them closely but added more details here and there, e.g. a shield on the back, as he feels and as the production methods require.


The Indigogo campaign will finish on beginning of december.
Allan Carrasco will sculpt the miniature as soon as the main goal is reached.
The resin miniature will normally be available in February.

Regular updates with WIP shots to all contributors …

The creation of a miniature of this scale requires a lot of investment in terms of time and resources. The team members make their living from painting and sculpting so a certain degree of profitability needs to be assured before they can commit to the project.

The funding we hope to gain will cover the sculpting, molding, casting, packaging and release of Rocco and as a thank you for your support, offer the model at a discount price for contributors.

So if you want to have your own signed copy of this marvelous miniature or if you just want to help Rocco see the light of day, now is the time to contribute. A range of perks are proposed below to encourage those who would like to help make this project a success.



About Jérémie Bonamant Teboul

JBT is one of the best known names on the international miniatures scene. Living in Lyon, France, he has been painting miniatures for over twenty years. After working as a painter, sculptor, and art director for various miniature producers (Ilyad Games, Rackham, Kraken Edition, Artefactory) he has created his own company FIGONE (website). He is also a freelance painter and sculptor, and he has published best-selling books & DVDs on miniature painting.

Over twenty years, he has amassed a plethora of painting awards including:

  • 55 Golden Demons, 3 Slayer Swords (Germany 2004, France 2005, Canada 2006)

  • Several gold medals and Best of Show awards (Le petit Soldat [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show [Switzerland], Monte San Savino [Italie], Girona [Spain])

  • Crystal Brush 2013 Overall Winner

  • Appointed World Expo judge in 2008 (Spain)

To learn more about JBT please visit his website

About Allan Carrasco

Allan Carrasco is an internationally renowned miniature sculptor based in the south of France. He has worked as a freelance sculptor for Studio McVey, Figone, Dark Age, Enigma, Eden, Kingdom Death, Mierce Miniature, Predastore, Smart Max amongst others.

He has also collected a surfeit of trophies including:

  • Multiple Golden Demon winner

  • French Slayer Sword winner in 2008

  • Many gold medals (Le petit Soldat [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show, [Switzerland], Monte San Savino [Italie], Girona [Spain])

  • Appointed World Expo judge in 2008 (Spain)

More information on Alan and his work can be found on his website
story_txt:
Jérémie Bonamant Teboul and
Allan Carrasco, two stars of the miniatures scene, are teaming up to produce
Rocco, one huge, brute of a miniature. This is your chance to help bring this
ambitious project to life.
As aficionados of his work can attest,
monsters and orcs are Allan’s specialties. At shows around the world people kept
asking him when he’s going to uses his skills to a large, mounted 54 mm fantasy character. The answer was always, when the time and money are available.
FIGONE is a French miniatures company
founded by Jérémie in 2009 and dedicated to producing and selling high quality
figures for collectors, sculptors and painters. FIGONE has
what it takes to make a finished sculpt commercially available.
With Indiegogo and your help to fund
this huge, highly anticipated project, Rocco was born.

ROCCO will be the biggest miniature
ever produced by FIGONE and the largest ever sculpted by Allan Carrasco.

Rocco will be a large 54mm
scale miniature cast in high quality resin, approximately 120 mm high, composed of 16
pieces. Here you'll see the final miniature, along with the final concept by artist
Bertrand Benoit.Don’t forget that Allan is an artist
and these drawings have served as inspiration rather than a concrete blueprint.
He followed them closely but added more details here and there, e.g.
a shield on the back, as he feels and as the production methods require.

The Indigogo campaign will
finish on beginning of december.
Allan Carrasco will sculpt the miniature as soon as the main goal is reached.
The resin miniature will normally be available in February.
Regular updates with WIP shots to all
contributors …

The creation
of a miniature of this scale requires a lot of investment in terms of time and
resources. The team members make their living from painting and sculpting so a
certain degree of profitability needs to be assured before they can commit to the
project.
The funding we
hope to gain will cover the sculpting, molding, casting, packaging and release
of Rocco and as a thank you for your support, offer the model at a discount
price for contributors.
So if you want
to have your own signed copy of this marvelous miniature or if you just want to help
Rocco see the light of day, now is the time to contribute. A range of perks are
proposed below to encourage those who would like to help make this project a
success.






About Jérémie Bonamant TeboulJBT is one of the best known names on the
international miniatures scene. Living in Lyon, France, he has been painting
miniatures for over twenty years. After working as a painter, sculptor, and art
director for various miniature producers (Ilyad Games, Rackham, Kraken Edition,
Artefactory) he has created his own company FIGONE (website). He is also a freelance painter
and sculptor, and he has published best-selling books & DVDs on miniature
painting.Over twenty years, he has
amassed a plethora of painting awards including:
55 Golden Demons, 3 Slayer Swords (Germany 2004, France 2005,
     Canada 2006)
Several gold medals and Best of Show awards (Le petit Soldat
     [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show [Switzerland], Monte San
     Savino [Italie], Girona [Spain])
Crystal Brush 2013 Overall Winner
Appointed World Expo judge in 2008 (Spain)
To
learn more about JBT please visit his website
About Allan Carrasco
Allan Carrasco is an
internationally renowned miniature sculptor based in the south of France. He
has worked as a freelance sculptor for Studio McVey, Figone, Dark Age, Enigma,
Eden, Kingdom Death, Mierce Miniature, Predastore, Smart Max amongst others. 
He has also collected a surfeit of trophies including:

Multiple Golden Demon winner
French Slayer Sword winner in 2008
Many
     gold medals (Le petit Soldat [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show, [Switzerland], Monte San Savino [Italie], Girona
     [Spain])
Appointed World Expo judge in 2008 (Spain)


More information on Alan and his work can be found on his website

story:
What?
I'm going to finish circumnavigating the 48 US states counterclockwise by car. I've already driven more than 7000 miles to central upstate NY. This is a part 2 to my funding to help get me home to Los Angeles. I'll capture images as I drive and then take this data and create some road art, especially for you!

Why am I asking for help?
I raised almost $2700 [$2400 net] in my first campaign. My expenses so far have been $3327 for gas, food, lodging, and rent at home. I have 10 more driving days and more rent due. Then there's the June exhibition of work generated from this project to be held at TAG Gallery in Bergamot Station, Santa Monica. I estimate that will cost at least $2000 for production costs.

What's in it for you?
You get to take a virtual road trip from the comfort of your chair without having to sit in a car with me for 8 hours. 
At every perk level above $10, you will be able to choose which image I will transform into your art reward.
You will be a modern Medici!

What do the perks look like?

Nice N Easy listing on the donor "AAA List" page with optional link

Roadrunner regional postcard from the road
(maybe this sample -- I still have 2)

Wawa digital watercolor painting on paper

Phillips 66 digital painting on paper

Maverik ink sketch from the road
(probably interior of a cafe from lunchtime stop)

Pilot [prototype sample shown -- same as Wawa, printed on metal]

7 Eleven medium sized oil painting

Circle K pastel on paper, framed

Other Ways You Can Help
Share on your social media venue of choice!
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Read and see more:

Keep up to date on the On the Edge US blog

story:
What project, boss?

I'm Sean M Posey, and I love to take crazy pictures. Right now, I am contemplating six dastardly murders, but to make this project possible, I need your help.

If you choose to support me, you won’t be asked to move any bodies. You won’t be charged as an accessory to murder. Instead, you’ll help me launch a photography show about murderers, their psychology, and our perceptions of these two things.

The Real McCoy

A little background about myself first. I attended Florida Atlantic University for theater before leaving (at the advice of my professor) to go pursue a career in the arts. Unfortunately I was sidetracked. Life tends to do that to you sometimes.

I have spent a good portion of my adult life working various skilled labor jobs.  Five years ago, I realized I had been neglecting the artist in me, and so I dove right back in. This time, instead of acting, I now have a camera in my hand.

Over the last three years, I have worked on and off with many art shows. I've had seven shows with one or two other artists, I've been involved in hanging and marketing for these shows as well. For three years running, I have been an integral participant in the St. Louis Naughti Gras Erotic Arts Show, arranging the works and hanging many of the pieces in those shows.

Guys and Dolls

Six murderers will each have three photos associated with them.

The first photo, which you have already seen, is simply a portrait taken of that person before the murder has taken place.

The second photograph is an artist’s representation of the killer, taken mere moments after the murder has occurred.  This second image contains enough information to connect the murder with the crime, but it offers little insight into the murderer’s motive.

If you want to try to understand the murderer, you must study the third and final picture in each series. In this photograph, you will find important evidence which reveals the innermost character of a murderer.

And this is truly the purpose of the show. I ask viewers to question their perceptions. What motives would bring one human being to end the life of another?

I would like to challenge you, as you view the first half of the show, to guess the character of our various persons, the methods by which they performed their first murder, and finally, what drove each of them to this most vicious of crimes.

While you walk through the exhibit, read everything. Consider all parts of each piece of art; every choice is  intentional. There are no accidents in art, and I will provide you with plenty of clues about the motive of each murderer.

Why's this the cat's pajamas?

This project, which I call “THE MOTIVE,” will be my first solo show.

This is a project that was born of a love for art and photography. More importantly, it’s based on a love of detective stories in popular culture.  I want the show to put the attendees in the shoes of the detectives, while also making it an entertaining experience to participate in art.  I hope to share my love of the game and cultural phenomenon.

At first glance, "THE MOTIVE" could easily be dismissed as a gimmick, using shock and visual cliches to elicit a response from the viewer.  But the intent of these pieces is actually to challenge our societal views on art, pop media, psychology, and crime.

Unlike other art shows, there is a motive for viewing these photographs, aside from appreciating their particular merits as art.  I want viewers to think about the people in the photographs, fictional though they may be, and use that as a mirror to consider them as real people and how they would behave.

I have always had a fascination with murder, although not in a sense that I feel compelled to commit one.  No, I'm far more interested in what would drive someone to kill another human being.  I grew up feeding on pop culture: reading comic books and scary true-crime novels, watching cop shows, and seeing movies about serial killers.

That's precisely what this show is about: pop culture, comic books, and the motives behind killings.

The nuts and bolts, senator.

All of the 19 photographs have already been shot.  Many elements can be seen throughout the video, tiny pieces of each photograph showing a glimpse of what I have hidden behind the curtain.

As many of you know, photographic prints are very expensive as are the frames and the matboard and all of the other bits that go into hanging art.  And I can't afford to do this project on my own. 

Your pledges will go towards prints, frames, materials for the show itself (refreshments, snacks, etc.), and finally a tiny bit will go to the time it is going to take me to mount and hang this show.

Where's the jewels, Charlie?

If you pledge to this project, I have a crazy list of rewards to choose from, including:

    Signed prints;

    A compiled book of the project; and

    A sneak peek tour of the show with the Butler.

So, please check out the full list of awesome pledge levels. You’ll find them in the column on the right.

Leave a note in the dead drop.

Progress updates will be as often as I have news to report.  Within three days of reaching the goal, I will place the order for the prints and start the process of shipping out the pledge rewards. 

Within 5 days I'll begin shopping for a venue.  I already have one gallery dying to display this work, and I have a couple of other places that are showing some interest.  

I plan to have this show up and running by the beginning of November. Reaching this crowdsourcing goal will go a long way to realizing that goal.

This isn't my first concept shoot to reach the print stage (Alice in Wonderland was my last big project) and with any luck it won't be the last.  Please help me make this dream of mine come true.  I promise, you won't be disappointed.

Thanks for taking the time to check out my work here, and please feel free to stop by my Blog and keep an eye on my past work as well as future projects.

story:
Please help me transfer Gospel Tract printing from Bond
paper to durable, waterproof Tyvek paper for street ministry distribution

 

My name is Stan Overton. 
I am a minister of the Gospel of Jesus Christ and enjoy sharing the good
news of God's grace and mercy. 

 I minister in the local jails and love to teach God's word wherever I am
led.  I have authored a gospel tract titled " Why Should God Allow You into Heaven" and have handed them out virtually everywhere you can imagine! 
Truck-stops, Airports, Bus Stations and street corners.  It is truly a blessing and an incredible feeling to hand someone a tract knowing that they may have an opportunity to gain fellowship with God for the first time! 

Since these pamphlets are handled quite a bit they are
subjected to some pretty rough conditions. 


It is not uncommon for them to become torn after frequent use.  Imagine having to pass around a single copy among countless men and women in prison. 

They are balled-up, torn and manipulated in every way imaginable. 
Using a durable paper like Tyvek will ensure the entire
gospel message can withstand the rigors of rough handling and extreme
environments.  The paper is designed more like a fabric and you simply cannot tear it apart nor mar it with excessive water.


There are only a few print shops that are able to print on
Tyvek paper and the funds raised will go 100% towards the printing and
production expenses of the company charged with producing the pamphlets.

I have printed the tracts in Spanish and soon, Farsi and Chinese.  I
look forward to sharing the gospel message on durable paper to missionaries in
these countries!


I am excited to gain your support!  God's word says "I have
planted", Apollos watered, but God gives the increase...This passage
simply means that God blesses every link of the chain, so thank you for helping
me to advance the ministry of  Jesus Christ!

story:
Maria TV

My name is Rodrigo Valenzuela.  I am a Chilean artist now based in Seattle.  I want to tell you about Maria TV and why I decided to start this campaign.  Maria TV is an experimental video/soap opera centered around Latina domestic workers (nannies, maids) as they are represented in the media, and as they exist in real, everyday life. For this project I will interview domestic workers and record them performing their everyday activities on the job.  In addition to this documentary footage, I will also create sets and direct reenactments of their roles as they are portrayed in film and on TV; all of which will be interwoven with clips of various telenovelas to create an hybridized narrative.  The all-women cast will perform for the camera both as the 'seen on TV' characters, and as themselves - representing their own stories, their own lives.  Playing out like a dress rehearsal of sorts, in combining these materials a slippery space is opened up - one that sits ambiguously between action and enactment, or 'real life' and fiction.  In doing so, my aim is to evidence and critique the blind-spots in media representation, and at the same time address an under-represented group's socioeconomic struggles in an engaging and intimate yet playful way. 

Maria TV was inspired by, and will be in dialogue with, a recent project entitled Diamond Box, which I created last year.  For this work I interviewed immigrant workers whom I hired from the Home Depot parking lot, lacing their personal stories together with silence and pause.  Produced with a $700 grant from Sprout, Diamond Box has since been nominated for the Vimeo Awards, exhibited at the Henry Art Gallery, NAAMNW, MOCA Miami, El Museo Cultural in Sante Fe, The National Academy Museum in NYC, the UC Irvine gallery and more.   

   

All of my work as an artist is, at its core, a commitment to empowering communities through creative intervention, and raising awareness about social and political issues.  Maria TV will be my longest and most involved video project yet, both in terms of length and production.  The opportunity to create Maria TV with external support would allow me to bring my work to the next level.

Budget and funding 

The total budget for Maria TV is $30,000.  I am fundraising for $10,000.  

I have secured $5,500 from 4Culture and $8,000 from The Seattle Office of Arts & Cultural affairs.  Additionally, $6,500 will come from art sales and my work as a teacher. This, however, will mostly be awarded/earned upon completion of the project, whereas I have virtually nothing with which to begin it.  I am therefore fundraising $10,000 for equipment and pre-production (such as stage fabrication, costumes, studio rental etc.). 

In my original budget I did not factor in the cost of equipment since I already had nearly everything I needed, including my own HD camera and audio equipment.  Unfortunately, on a recent bus trip through Central America, during which I had planned to produce a new body of photographic work and shoot b-roll for Maria TV, I was robbed of everything.  A group broke into the house we were staying in and, while we slept, stole both of my cameras (5D and Pentax 67), my go-pro, audio gear, lenses, hard drives, memory cards, laptop, passport and greencard (totaling more than $10,000 - this bag of stuff basically constituted all of my worldly possessions, as well as my livelihood).  

I need to start shooting Maria TV by mid January! Renting the lost equipment is unrealistic since the day rate of the Canon 5D alone it is $200, and borrowing everything for a month of shooting is just unprofessional (and also logistically untenable).  This project means so much to me and I am devastated over the loss of my equipment and my ability to create the work as I'd imagined and planned.  

Your help would be deeply appreciated - and I am offering great rewards for it!!

story:
Summary

Hi, My name is Rebecca. I am an artist and business woman with experiance in many areas of sales and marketing. About two and a half years ago I decided to stay at home with my newborn baby and my ,then, five year old son and left to corperate world behind.

To help my family financially I started selling my art online again (I have been doing that on and off for the last 13 years). However, back in March of this year I ran across a great artist community trying to revitalize a dying mall here in Dallas. I took some of our savings and rented a 3,000 sqft shop at such a great price I just couldn't pass it up. 

Since I opened the community has grown by leaps and bounds! We now have 1/3+ of the mall inhabited by galleries and studios and have brought life back into the building with art walks, 1-2 charity auctions a month, and some great events featuring art, music and entertainment. My shop has also grown, each month I am able to take some of the money my studio makes and re-invest it into more products for my store/gallery. It has been slow going, only adding a handful of one type new product per month featuring my art on it. In addition to my original art I am now able to offer:

4 different sizes of prints

greeting cards

Tile coasters

iPhone cases

t-shirts

Tote bags

& a few other small items

I make all these by hand, they are not purchased from print shops. This is how I have been able to save on supply costs, but, it also takes considerable time, determination, and commitment. I have done all of this with my children (now 2.5 and 7 years old) at my side! This has been a dream of mine for so long that I am so excited and blessed to have been able to do this. And my two boys just LOVE the experience of meeting with customers, creating art of their own and working in the same building as so many other great artists!

Even if I can get some of the money I need I will be able to expand my product line. This in turn will help me make more money to build up to my goal.


What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to be able to add about 10-20 more product lines that will appeal to my target audience before Christmas. Including: Ornaments, mugs, travel mugs, more varieties of phone cases, more clothing and accessories, jewelry, shot glasses, iPad covers, laptop skins and much more. All while keeping in mind that most these items will be hand made using raw materials, a printer and my painting skills. 

Because of the time involved and the fact that I still have my online shops, marketing, packaging and shipping, custom paintings, and my customers to tend to I will also need to hire a helper for the Holiday season as a temp to hire. I already have someone in mind that can take over my wed marketing, update my site with new art as i make it, keep my other online venues up to date, package and ship items as they sell online and keep my shop open when I can't be there (the mall is open 10-9 every day and 12-6 Sundays, one person just can't work those hours while having their kids with them most that time) While I create more art, make the hand made products we sell, deal with customer requests and keep up with the financial side of the business.

In order to be able to expand my product line and have a nice padding to be able to afford the extra help for the next few months I will need $10,000. Half of this will go to supplies to make products and to order those products I can not make myself while the other half will go into and account to pay my employee with we are increasing our inventory and until the holiday sales kick in, this way I know for sure I will be able to pay my assistant for the first couple of months until we have the inventory to produce the sales I need to keep her on.

***In return for your support I am offering you some great gifts!!! Some of these you may want to keep fr your self and some would also be great to give to friends and family as a Christmas present this year!***
For $1 you will get a personalized thank you message from me explaining what I was able to accomplish with your contribution. No amount is too small and every penny I receive to make this happen is greatly appreciated. Those single dollar contributions really add up, so THANK YOU!
For $3 you will also get a message from me, as well as I limited edition signed art trading card print on one of my paintings.
For $5 you will receive all the above and a greeting card that is blank inside and is also a frame able art print, it is signed and dated by me. This would be a great item to keep for your self or give to a friend for a birthday or the Holidays
For $10 You will get all the above and a cute handmade tile magnet with one of my art images on it.
For $25 you will get all of the above and an ornament with one of my art images on it.
For $50 you will receive all the above and a set of 4 handmade tile coasters with my art on it!
For $75 You will get all of the above and a 8x10 inch art print signed and dated by me.
For $100 you will get all of the above and a mug with one of my art images on it.
For $150 you will get all the above and a t-shirt with one of my images on it.
For $200 you will get all of the above and a 8x10 inch painting.
For $300 you will get everything from the $1-$150 range plus a 11x14 inch painting.
For $500 you will get everything from the $1-$150 range plus a 16x20 inch painting.
For $750 you will get everything from the $1-$150 range plus a 20x24 inch painting.
For $1,000 you will get everything from the $1-$150 range plus a 24x30 inch painting.
For $1,500 you will get everything from the $1-$150 range plus a 8x10 inch painting every month for a year.
For $2,500 you will get everything from the $1-$150 range plus a 9x12 inch painting every month for a year.
For $5,000 you will get everything from the $1-$150 range plus a 11x14 inch painting every month for a year.
For $10,000 you will get everything from the $1-$150 range plus a 16x20 inch painting every month for a year.

The Impact

Not only would you be halping me with this contrubution, but by helping even my one shop in our artist community you are helping the entire comunity grow. By offering more products to my store/gallery I will be able to help bring even more peole into our comunity and will be able to help bring more art to more people's lives. 
Also, by being able to hire someone I you will also help provide someone with a job and as I grow I can hire more people and provide more jobs to our comunity.

Other Ways You Can Help

As I said before, even $1 can make a difference! But, if you can not contribute you can still help. Please share this campaign with your friends and family. It's easy! Just click on the share buttons to let your friends know about this campaign!


Thank you so much :)
story_txt:
Summary
Hi, My name is Rebecca. I am an artist and business woman with experiance in many areas of sales and marketing. About two and a half years ago I decided to stay at home with my newborn baby and my ,then, five year old son and left to corperate world behind.
To help my family financially I started selling my art online again (I have been doing that on and off for the last 13 years). However, back in March of this year I ran across a great artist community trying to revitalize a dying mall here in Dallas. I took some of our savings and rented a 3,000 sqft shop at such a great price I just couldn't pass it up. 
Since I opened the community has grown by leaps and bounds! We now have 1/3+ of the mall inhabited by galleries and studios and have brought life back into the building with art walks, 1-2 charity auctions a month, and some great events featuring art, music and entertainment. My shop has also grown, each month I am able to take some of the money my studio makes and re-invest it into more products for my store/gallery. It has been slow going, only adding a handful of one type new product per month featuring my art on it. In addition to my original art I am now able to offer:
4 different sizes of prints
greeting cards
Tile coasters
iPhone cases
t-shirts
Tote bags
& a few other small items
I make all these by hand, they are not purchased from print shops. This is how I have been able to save on supply costs, but, it also takes considerable time, determination, and commitment. I have done all of this with my children (now 2.5 and 7 years old) at my side! This has been a dream of mine for so long that I am so excited and blessed to have been able to do this. And my two boys just LOVE the experience of meeting with customers, creating art of their own and working in the same building as so many other great artists!
Even if I can get some of the money I need I will be able to expand my product line. This in turn will help me make more money to build up to my goal.



What We Need & What You Get
My goal is to be able to add about 10-20 more product lines that will appeal to my target audience before Christmas. Including: Ornaments, mugs, travel mugs, more varieties of phone cases, more clothing and accessories, jewelry, shot glasses, iPad covers, laptop skins and much more. All while keeping in mind that most these items will be hand made using raw materials, a printer and my painting skills. 
Because of the time involved and the fact that I still have my online shops, marketing, packaging and shipping, custom paintings, and my customers to tend to I will also need to hire a helper for the Holiday season as a temp to hire. I already have someone in mind that can take over my wed marketing, update my site with new art as i make it, keep my other online venues up to date, package and ship items as they sell online and keep my shop open when I can't be there (the mall is open 10-9 every day and 12-6 Sundays, one person just can't work those hours while having their kids with them most that time) While I create more art, make the hand made products we sell, deal with customer requests and keep up with the financial side of the business.

In order to be able to expand my product line and have a nice padding to be able to afford the extra help for the next few months I will need $10,000. Half of this will go to supplies to make products and to order those products I can not make myself while the other half will go into and account to pay my employee with we are increasing our inventory and until the holiday sales kick in, this way I know for sure I will be able to pay my assistant for the first couple of months until we have the inventory to produce the sales I need to keep her on.

story:
- BORED NO MORE -

STL IMPROV ANYWHERE TO THE RESCUE!

WE MAKE ST. LOUIS MORE INTERESTING. WE CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOU TO EXPERIENCE THE CITY IN A WAY YOU NEVER HAVE. WE REMIND ST. LOUISANS TO LAUGH, BREATHE, AND THAT OUR CITY IS AMAZING!

++MAKE A DONATION TO HELP US ACTIVATE THE CITY++

How awesome would your weekly grocery trip be if an a cappella group sang to you about the watermelon you were buying? Would you ride the Metrolink more often if there were guerilla performances on the train? How warm and fuzzy would you feel about your city if a group of frolicking cupids handed you a hand-made Valentine’s Day card on your lunch break?

We do this. All the time.

Meet STL Improv Anywhere.

   

What is STL Improv Anywhere? 

STL Improv Anywhere is a site-specific performance art troupe that brings spontaneity and creativity to public spaces of St. Louis, MO. Through large participatory events and guerilla performances, STL IA creates opportunities for citizens to engage more meaningfully with each other and with the shared spaces of their city. We have created over 35 performances/events in the past two years, including the No Pants Metrolink Ride, Pillow Fight Day, performances throughout the Grove, Cherokee Street, Downtown, Clayton, and numerous other spaces throughout St. Louis. Our work invites spectators to become active participants. Our events rattle reality, encourage interaction between strangers and push the boundaries of city-making. (It’s a beautiful thing.)

When performing, STL IA blurs the line between reality and performance: Am I actually getting arrested? Is that person’s mustache real? In this way, we blend life and art. It is hard to tell when your ‘regular day’ ended and your magical one began. By blurring these lines and placing art in the context of the everyday, we hope to suggest that there is in fact no difference between the mundane and the magical, that the city is special and that its inhabitants are capable of making it interesting.

STL Improv Anywhere is comprised of a growing collective of St. Louisans that love their city and want to be more involved in its evolution. They are risk-takers, often with no performance background but a desire to do something they’ve never done before, and a fervent love for their city.

How did this begin?

Director Mallory Nezam moved back from Europe in 2010 and noticed that public spaces in St. Louis were quiet. Determined to activate the spaces of a re-emerging city that she believed in, she gathered a crew of 4 friends to participate in an art event to test out the idea. What started as a one-time project spread like chicken pox in a preschool. Two years and 35 performances later, STL Improv Anywhere is still going strong because we are providing a service to the city that no one else is. Countless spontaneous participants give positive affirmation of our potential to challenge typical conceptions of public space and modes of interaction.

   

Why we need your financial support.

The inertia is here. We want to use it for bigger and better things. As city-wide events continue to rise in participation, more funding and volunteer efforts are needed. Funding will go to:

  • Renting office space at Nebula Coworking on Cherokee Street
  • Producing more frequent, large participatory events like the No Pants Metrolink Ride & Pillow Fight Day
  • Creating a new website that is more user-friendly
  • Promotional material to get the word out about our amazing events
  • Purchasing our own video camera and editing software to become more self-sufficient and supply you with entertaining videos and coverage of our performances/events
  • Branding/identity development, including STL Improv Anywhere fan merchandise

We want to host larger events more frequently, and to reach out to include more St. Louisans. In the end, we are doing this for our city – to build a more interesting and engaged populace, to empower citizens to become creators and to further define creative experience. We are asking for funding to make our awesome city even more interesting, lively and active.

WE LOVE YOU, 314. HELP US ACTIVATE THE CITY.

   

What people have said about STL Improv Anywhere:

 “Thanks for organizing the No Pants Metro Ride. It was fun to get out and give people a laugh...maybe St.Louisans will lighten up a little. Little did I know when I went to Kaldi's that I would be going on such an adventure. To Life without Pants!”

“Had SUCH a good time. Fabulous seeing old friends and great making new ones. Thanks for letting me be a part of this fun event!”

“Awesome good time! I met many new friends and reconnected with some I'd met last summer at the StL WNBR. Thanks to STL IA and all involved for organizing.”

And our personal favorite:

“You made me not hate Valentine’s Day.”

Broke but still want to support us? Donated and want to do even more? Here's how:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Share this link on Facebook, Twiiter, blogs, email & tell your friends! ('Share tools' are right underneath our video)

VISIT OUR WEBSITE: stl-improv-anywhere.tumblr.com

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/STLImprovAnywhere

TWITTER: @stlimprovanywr

“Awesome good time! I met many new friends and reconnected with some I'd met last summer at the StL WNBR. Thanks to STL IA and all involved for organizing.”
And our personal favorite:
“You made me not hate Valentine’s Day.”
Broke but still want to support us? Donated and want to do even more? Here's how:



Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Share this link on Facebook, Twiiter, blogs, email & tell your friends! ('Share tools' are right underneath our video)

VISIT OUR WEBSITE: stl-improv-anywhere.tumblr.com

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/STLImprovAnywhere

TWITTER: @stlimprovanywr

story:
What it is.

The Tesla bill, is an art project designed to commemorate one of the greatest scientists of all time, with the proceeds going to help fund research being conducted by a local community of amateur scientists, by providing them with a space to work from and resources to work with. What this means is that the facility will be publicly accessible to anyone who wants to conduct research or needs access to tooling and such for building parts for an experiment

  • Who am I? Many know me as the Architect, or as the primary designer and artist behind many of the items created at Borg Steam Factory.
  • Have ideas for research projects you'd like to see? Want to help with art, marketing, or other practical ways to help us succeed? Are you a scientist with a great idea, but no workspace?
    (you can contact me directly via www.borgsteamfactory.com/contact.html)and GET INVOLVED

I believe this project is important because every day we forget that Tesla has a legacy, even though he had no biological heirs, as his way of seeing the universe and approaching science has indeed effected us, as well as nearly every scientist that has ever been since his time. This bill I hope will remind us of this fact, and fund future scientists, creating a wave of thinking that will further persuade people to fund those working to make the world a better place.

Your donations will both help fund a local research facility and work space (see here: http://www.voxelblock.com/page2.html ) that will offer space to work on research and send further help to other similar workshops and hacker/maker spaces around the globe, as well as help me to secure the resources to produce an incredible piece that has both an artistic presence, and is made with a very high quality standard, for instance

What We Need & What You Get

1. I will need resources for making custom paper

the reasons for this are:

  • Paper will be resistant to the chemicals in counterfeit pens, to allow you to verify that they are indeed genuine.
  • Paper will have fibers through out, colors of the fibers will match an over all Tesla based color scheme.
  • Paper will have a strip inside reading "just say no to greed".
  • Paper will have proper watermarks.

***NEW*** each bill will have an extra layer of protecting the authenticity of the unit, not only will they have individual serial numbers, but to transfer ownership we will keep your original email address on hand as the owner, on a separate off line computer with the serial numbers of the bills you have purchased, and if you opt to, will also include a password you will need to call in and give us, that will be needed to transfer ownership of the bill with that serial number. This will be used in the event of theft, to allow easier replacement as we will issue a new bill with new serial number and mark the stolen one in our database, in case anyone comes forward with information on it's whereabouts. The cost for replacement too will be only the shipping required to get your new bill to you, so the cost of obtaining the first one sort of includes a pretty good insurance against theft as well, and this will be for the life time of myself, and anyone who takes over the project.

  • TL:DR of the above is that to transfer the bill you will need to write us FROM the email we have on record and give us the new recipients email to change our records, and if you added the password, call us to confirm with that password, that you are transferring the bill ownership to the new person. Then it will be their responsibility to call and set up a password for their ownership if they choose to take advantage of that option.
  • additionally if you call with a serial number and a name we can confirm if the owner is indeed the owner of a bill before you purchase it, or trade for it.

2. I will need to make custom metal press plates. This requires a number of steps to create a lasting image in a metal that will endure many pressings to ensure everyone wanting to have one of these bills, will get this opportunity.

and lastly

3. Custom ink. This will be made to have a lasting effect on the paper, not smear, and be extremely fade resistant. I will need 3 distinct colors, one for the front, one for the back, and one for the custom seals and serial numbers, (yes each bill will have it's own serial number identifying it and when it was printed up.)

How you can help.

In addition to donating, and spreading the word by sharing our project you will also be able to give your input on the project's development as it is progressing (if you wish. No one will twist your arm :) ).

to keep up, I will do updates with photo progress of the project, and ask questions, run polls and such on design and color schemes, additionally, I will send emails to those who wish to have them, and you can reply via these emails with your thoughts. If it turns out to be a popular idea, I will set up a forum for people to discuss this as well.

the first issue will be to discuss what the denomination is for, so far I am for using time, and designating this bill as the hour. What are your thoughts?

For those wishing to see other examples of my work:

The above image is a collage of one of my pieces and the image of Tesla I intend to use. Here are some links to others, (*and a bigger version of the one in the above, so you can see some of the detail)

https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-prn1/378855_2482875270031_270769041_n.jpg

https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc6/168418_1631360742700_1107347_n.jpg

https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/378855_2482875310032_1874429697_n.jpg

https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc6/168159_1631363942780_265149_n.jpg

https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/378855_2482875230030_1115163939_n.jpg

https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-frc1/378855_2482875350033_189739158_n.jpg

https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc7/375561_2482893710492_2012804978_n.jpg

https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc6/375561_2482893750493_1020769858_n.jpg

https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/375561_2482893790494_1775572776_n.jpg

https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/32597_4870704684274_1723429914_n.jpg

https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-prn1/31443_4870704284264_2122177356_n.jpg

https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/537014_4870704564271_1011055008_n.jpg

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Post the links to this on your personal pages and blogs!
  • Email friends and tell them about it! (you know your friends so you should know who will appreciate knowing about this, and who will be annoyed so. :)

     Lastly, the quality of the bills will be dependent on the amount I receive at the end of the campaign, such as the materials used for making paper, or amount of security measures incorporated into the bills. However, the quality of the engraved images used will not suffer for this no matter how little is obtained, and all will get their bills issued as perks here.

     After these are sent out, a possibility of more being printed is highly likely, however all purchasers after the campaign is over will have to pay the prices AND shipping, so getting in now guarantees a really good price break if you consider the perks a purchase, not to mention preference on serial numbers which is what will make these most collectable. 

 

     Additionally, if this is successful, more scientists and inventors will be added to the list with different denominations under their visage, such as a potential 1 day note for Albert Einstein, or a one week note for Leonardo da Vinci or Galileo Galilei. I will even entertain minting coins for partial hours.

keep checking back and sharing :)

additionally if you call with a serial number and a name we can confirm if the owner is indeed the owner of a bill before you purchase it, or trade for it.


2. I will need to make custom metal press plates. This requires a number of steps to create a lasting image in a metal that will endure many pressings to ensure everyone wanting to have one of these bills, will get this opportunity.
and lastly
3. Custom ink. This will be made to have a lasting effect on the paper, not smear, and be extremely fade resistant. I will need 3 distinct colors, one for the front, one for the back, and one for the custom seals and serial numbers, (yes each bill will have it's own serial number identifying it and when it was printed up.)


How you can help.
In addition to donating, and spreading the word by sharing our project you will also be able to give your input on the project's development as it is progressing (if you wish. No one will twist your arm :) ).to keep up, I will do updates with photo progress of the project, and ask questions, run polls and such on design and color schemes, additionally, I will send emails to those who wish to have them, and you can reply via these emails with your thoughts. If it turns out to be a popular idea, I will set up a forum for people to discuss this as well.
the first issue will be to discuss what the denomination is for, so far I am for using time, and designating this bill as the hour. What are your thoughts?
For those wishing to see other examples of my work:
The above image is a collage of one of my pieces and the image of Tesla I intend to use. Here are some links to others, (*and a bigger version of the one in the above, so you can see some of the detail)https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-prn1/378855_2482875270031_270769041_n.jpghttps://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc6/168418_1631360742700_1107347_n.jpg
https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/378855_2482875310032_1874429697_n.jpg
https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc6/168159_1631363942780_265149_n.jpg
https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/378855_2482875230030_1115163939_n.jpg
https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-frc1/378855_2482875350033_189739158_n.jpg
https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc7/375561_2482893710492_2012804978_n.jpg
https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc6/375561_2482893750493_1020769858_n.jpg
https://sphotos-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/375561_2482893790494_1775572776_n.jpg
https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/32597_4870704684274_1723429914_n.jpg
https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-prn1/31443_4870704284264_2122177356_n.jpg
https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/537014_4870704564271_1011055008_n.jpg
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Post the links to this on your personal pages and blogs!
Email friends and tell them about it! (you know your friends so you should know who will appreciate knowing about this, and who will be annoyed so. :)


     Lastly, the quality of the bills will be dependent on the amount I receive at the end of the campaign, such as the materials used for making paper, or amount of security measures incorporated into the bills. However, the quality of the engraved images used will not suffer for this no matter how little is obtained, and all will get their bills issued as perks here.
     After these are sent out, a possibility of more being printed is highly likely, however all purchasers after the campaign is over will have to pay the prices AND shipping, so getting in now guarantees a really good price break if you consider the perks a purchase, not to mention preference on serial numbers which is what will make these most collectable. 
 
     Additionally, if this is successful, more scientists and inventors will be added to the list with different denominations under their visage, such as a potential 1 day note for Albert Einstein, or a one week note for Leonardo da Vinci or Galileo Galilei. I will even entertain minting coins for partial hours.keep checking back and sharing :)

story:
*UPDATE*    Branches of the Military Supporter Challenge:

The first stop of the national tour will be given to the branch of service that comes in first place.  And the last spot on the tour will receive the final stop on the tour. Add your name to the branch of service you are in or support, and help us ask others to do the same.

World-renowned, Eisner Award-winning artist Dave Dorman is proud to announce his most exciting project to date: PROJECT 52. Dave is honoring each week we are protected by the men and women in the military by  painting 52 one-of-a-kind, military-inspired paintings. Once this gallery series is completed, the paintings will be displayed at military bases throughout the U.S. and then published as a signed, limited edition collector's item book and fine art lithograph.

Proceeds from this project will benefit USACares.org, the organization helping financially challenged post 9/11 military families. USACares.org is proud to be a partner in PROJECT 52. Please help fund this important project to help Dave change the lives of those brave men and women serving our country, as well as their families.

About the Artist
Dave Dorman was voted the #1 Star Wars Artist by the fans, has won the prestigious Eisner Award (the comic book industry's Oscar Award) and in 2010 won the prestigious Inkpot Award from San Diego Comic-Con International, where he was a V.I.P. guest. Dave's fans around the world love his luscious, realistic oil paintings of  celebrities, pop culture icons (Batman, Star Wars, Indiana Jones, Alien v. Predator, Spiderman, Lord of the Rings, Harry Potter, Green Hornet, Green Lantern, Star Trek, Battlestar Galactica, Captain America, G.I. Joe, World of Warcraft, Magic: The Gathering, to name a few), and science fiction, fantasy and horror genres, as well as his fine art work. Dave is the proud son of United States Air Force Lieutenant Colonel Jack Dorman, now deceased.

story:
After reading an article about the student constructed mural at Buena Vista Horace Mann K-8 Community School in the San Francisco Mission District that was accidentally covered up by maintenance crews, I felt the need to help. These students spent nearly two years working on this mural to have all of their hard work and dedication covered up by a coat of primer.

Please help fund the reconstruction of this mural and restore the art that these children completed.

See school website if you'd like to sing up to help restore the mural.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

http://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/SF-school-scrambles-to-restore-obliterated-mural-3659518.php#photo-3113265

SF school scrambles to restore obliterated mural

Jill Tucker
Updated 11:52 a.m., Monday, June 25, 2012

Less than a month after San Francisco middle school students put finishing touches on a brightly colored mural that took the better part of two years to plan, draw and paint, district workers followed orders to cover it up with a coat of yellow primer.

Only after the images of the Golden Gate Bridge, the school's fire-breathing dragon mascot and 200 feet of monkeys, yellow fish, blue waves and the city's polychromatic skyline were virtually obliterated did anyone realize the summer-break work order was a terrible mistake.

"A mural is a lot of work. Keeping kids focused on it is a lot of motivation," said Megan McMahon, the Buena Vista Horace Mann K-8 school art teacher who coordinated the project.

She received a text message on June 14 saying all the effort had been wiped out with a quick coat of paint.

"My stomach just dropped," she said. "It was like a year and half worth of work."

The problems started earlier in the school year when parents participated in a committee to address maintenance issues at the school.

They decided that the entire building and adjacent walls needed a fresh coat of paint, including several murals that were falling apart or had been painted by a church group that had previously used the Mission District building.

They didn't know the long mural along the base of the Bartlett Street wall below a chain-link fence was new and created by current students. Administrators who approved the request were also unaware of the mural's importance.

When all the parties involved found out, they were devastated, district spokeswoman Gentle Blythe said in an e-mail explaining the mural's misfortune.

"Once they realized that this mural was new and the teacher who worked on it was understandably upset, the parents who were involved in the facilities committee were very apologetic," she said.

School administrators were working with contractors, the teacher and the school to figure out if the mural could be saved.

McMahon was surprised by the overwhelming response.

"I thought it was going to be something shoved under the carpet," she said. "There was an apology and responsibility was taken for it."

The mural covered about two-thirds of the wall, and McMahon had hoped to work with students starting in the fall to plan and finish the rest.

But the question is: Now what?

With only one coat of paint over the mural, hazy images still show through and it's possible that, working from student drawings, the mural can be re-created, McMahon said.

Parents have volunteered to help.

McMahon said adults could redraw the outlines and then the whole community could help fill in the blue waves teeming with schools of yellow fish, the brown swinging monkey, the green cactus, City Hall's gold dome, and the orange and black at AT&T Park.

"That might be a way to restore what happened, and more people will be involved in it and think it's theirs," the teacher said. "We've learned a lot of lessons through it. I think it'll come back together."

Jill Tucker is a San Francisco Chronicle staff writer. E-mail: jtucker@sfchronicle.com
