story:
Short Summary

What if the only thing you had to do to fund outstanding arts education in your community was have a beer at your local bar?

The Art Bar and Theater is an innovative food, art, and performance venue designed to escape traditional funding models for the arts, train artists in successful entrepreneurship, and fund arts education in local communities – all while serving up great beer, tasty food, and an eclectic range of art.


If this campaign succeeds, the Art Bar will be able to open doors on a brick and mortar location within the year, adding to the growing “philanthro-pub” movement across the country. Philanthropubs such as United Libations in SF, The Oregon Public House in Portland, and CAUSE DC in Washington DC are already successfully showing that pub sales can change the world as they donate 100% of their profits to worthy organizations. 

The Art Bar takes that model one step further. The artists who work behind the bar create diverse arts programming for the venue AND provide free arts education and outreach to the local community – all funded by your purchase of that beer, sandwich or coffee you were going to buy anyway. We’re helping to solve the arts funding and education crisis – one pint at a time.




What You Get When You Support Us


The perks we’re offering showcase some of our work as artists – think of it as a preview of the kind of programming we’ll be able to make available both at the Art Bar itself and in local schools and the community at large.

Kevin, the director of the project, is a writer with both an MFA in poetry and a heck of a lot of street cred. He’s known locally for his street poetry, as you can see in the video below. His short, sweet poems are local favorites for occasions from birthdays to baby showers. Backers who receive poems on a topic of their choice will be amazed by what Kevin can do from a simple prompt like “Orange” or “Thirtieth anniversary.” The books of poetry are collections of poems requested by local from his inventive “poetry cart.”


Alyssa’s book Blood Orange is a gorgeous handmade artist book of poems from another young outstanding poet.

Jericha Senyak is a dancer and an artist with a synesthetic sensibility and a preoccupation with joy.  Her unique, intricate, assemblage-style altar boxes combine objects and vintage collage to create startling, evocative, miniature worlds.

Backers who receive a personalized beer stein can drink in the knowledge that they’ve supported an innovative arts model based on beer – and what could be more satisfying than that? Cheers!

Impact

What else do you get when you fund an Art Bar?

You get an outstanding arts venue staffed by a team of poets, artists, and musicians who have a combined 50 years of restaurant experience between them.

You get an innovative funding model for the arts that takes one thing you probably already want – beer – and uses it to fund another thing you probably already want – great arts programming and great arts education in your community.

Instead of relying on ever-shrinking, ever-more-competitive grant funding to make sure your kids get meaningful access to arts education, you can now support the Art Bar and watch as the working artists pouring you a pint use your Friday night beer money to fund classes, workshops, and events in a diverse range of mediums from poetry to painting for your kids, families, and friends.

The Art Bar team already has a successful track record in producing superlative arts programming with a broad reach. Since March of 2013, the Art Bar Collaborators have been hosting a wide variety of arts events in a small cafe on the Tannery Arts Center property in Santa Cruz, CA. They have produced a hugely diverse range of events, from a weekly poetry show to a sold-out internet cat video film festival to dance performances by nationally renowned dance companies. Starting with a budget of zero, they have generated more than $3500 in support to local artists and brought a diverse and returning audience into a vibrant community space.

Believe it or not, this crew has raised the money to plan, book, and promote the shows, as well as purchasing an entire sound system for their performances and events, purely on money from poetry sales. That’s right, poetry sales. If this crew can succeed for six months on nothing but a budget based on selling poems to strangers on the street, just imagine what they could do with your funding!

The Art Bar could stand to provide over $10,000 in aid to schools every year via a sustainable income stream, while simultaneously providing hundreds of hours of classroom support per year in Santa Cruz alone.  In addition to providing Arts Education aid and an outstanding location for live arts events, we plan to offer entrepreneurial, music, language arts, and career building workshops to further engage the community.

And it’s even bigger than that. In order to provide the programming we envision, we’re planning to employ a service staff of outstanding, visionary artists and performers who aren’t just behind the bar – they’ll be producing the programming and teaching in your schools. We want these creative folks to have equally grand visions of their own, and to train them through our model to successfully implement similar models of their own. In short, the Art Bar is also an incubator, and we are actively encouraging the artists we work with to take our model and replicate it, tweak it, and perfect it elsewhere. That means our impact is multiplied -- by the number of cities interested and able to host an arts-education philanthro-pub and the number of artists we send out into the world with a new vision of what’s possible in creating artistic venues and art education.


Risks and Challenges

Our main challenge lies in successfully running The Art Bar in such a way that we turn a profit we can put to use to produce programming and outreach that supplements, rather than duplicates, existing programs in the local community.

To this end, we have cultivated relationships with the Arts Council of Santa Cruz County, as well as other county Arts Educators to connect with and augment current programming, collaborate with educator training, and avoid the duplication of available services & aid. We also have a team of solid business advisers and, as mentioned, a combined 50 years of food service and restaurant experience ourselves that we’ll put to work to ensure we make sound business decisions. After all, in addition to our programming, we want to make sure that the artists we employ behind the bar are getting a great foundation in entrepreneurship and successful business  practices, so that they can go out and start their own creative, innovative, sustainable, community-based projects like The Art Bar elsewhere!


Other Ways You Can Help

You are not just your money! Even if you can’t donate, please, PLEASE share with friends, educators, artists, beer-drinkers, administrators, family, and any other folks you think might like the idea of paying for arts education by buying a beer. You know that one teacher, or parent, or family friend, or local artist, who convinced you that painting was an awesome medium worth being passionate about? Or writing? or Shakespeare? or music? or dance? or performance? Please, please, share it with them.  

We’re artists, so we understand that it can be tough to put down money, even when you want to. (Although, hey, a $5 donation is the same price as a pint! Think you’d be willing to give up just one beer to help us get ours out there? ) But really: sharing is JUST as important as putting down your dollars. Word of mouth is priceless. We appreciate every moment you spend helping out, whether it’s with dollars or words.

If you’d like a stack of business cards with links to this campaign to pass out, we can hook that up. (We love the real world, and think it's a great place to interact with people.) If you tell us you’re so broke you can’t pay a dime but you shared it with everyone you know, heck, we’ll hook you up with a poem too! We’re hugely grateful to you for helping us realize this vision, and committed to making sure you feel that love.

story:
Hi - my  name is James Hilyer and I race track in Southern California.  My home track is the LA Velodrome.  I have been racing since 2009 and I am passionate about cycling.  I also race on the road.

I'm raising money to compete at the Six-Day race in Berlin in January. The Berliner Sechstagerennen is a classic 6-day Race celebrating it's 102nd edition. I am attending this event as part of my program to develop my 6 Day Racing Future. 6 Day Racing is a historic form of Bicycle Track Racing and is one of the few career paths for an up and coming track racer. I will be competing in Berlin with my teammate Anthony Novoa.

The trip will be expensive and any help you can give towards the cost would be much appreciated.   I estimate the cost to be around $2,000.  This will cover my air fare, cost of shipping my bike, hotel, car rental and food.  Thank you for making my dream possible.  Happy Holidays!

I am attending this event as part of my program to develop my 6 Day Racing Future. 6 Day Racing is a historic form of Bicycle Track Racing and is one of the few career paths for an up and coming track racer. I will be competing in Berlin with my teammate Anthony Novoa.
The trip will be expensive and any help you can give towards the cost would be much appreciated.   I estimate the cost to be around $2,000.  This will cover my air fare, cost of shipping my bike, hotel, car rental and food.  Thank you for making my dream possible.  Happy Holidays!

story:
GET PIERCED 2: ELECTRIC BOOGALOO 

We're back, folks, and our poems are more pierced and polished than ever. For the second year in a row, the Pierced Ear Poetry Slam is absolutely ecstatic to represent the city of Stockton, CA at the National Poetry Slam.

» SLAM? «

WHAT'S THIS NEWFANGLED "SLAM" THE KIDS ARE TALKING ABOUT?

SLAM POETRY
A poetry slam is a spoken word competition in which poets are given a time limit to read or recite their work and are judged by selected members of the audience. Tracing its origins back to 1984 in Chicago, slam spread to the rest of North America and has touched every continent on the globe. Yes, even Antarctica.

NATIONAL POETRY SLAM
The National Poetry Slam (NPS) is an annual competition that began in 1990 at Fort Mason in San Francisco, CA with just four competing teams. This year, NPS is hosted in Boston, Massachussetts and will feature 70 teams from all across the nation and beyond. 

» TEAM? «

JUST WHO ARE THESE PEOPLE, ANYWAY?


JELAL HUYLER
Jelal is the 2013 Stockton Grand Slam Champion, an Oakland native, and a master of beast mode. He was also the 2010 Berkeley Grand Slam Champ, a member of the 2011 Team Oakland, and a poet mentor at the acclaimed outreach organization Youth Speaks. If asked about his titles and of which he is proudest, Jelal will undoubtedly reply “the one my momma gave me, my name.”


LEO BRYANT
Leo is a Bay Area based, born and raised poet. In his rookie year, after just 8 months in the scene, Leo became Grand Slam Champion and member of the 2011 Berkeley Slam Team. His honest performance has been described as possessing the ability to "heal midair". He was the 2012 San Francisco Grand Slam Champion, a member of the debut Pierced Ear Poetry Slam team in 2012, and an advocate of all things hug-related.


JAZ SUFI
Jaz Sufi is a poet, a Bay Area Native, an excavator of the human condition, and delighted to make your acquaintance. At 18, she became the slammaster of the Legendary Santa Cruz Indie Slam and the youngest slammaster of a PSI-certified venue in the country. Jaz was San Francisco's representative to the 2013 Women of the World Poetry Slam, a member of the first Pierced Ear Poetry Slam team in 2012, and a featured poet at the 2011 USF Creative Justice Art Show.


ROB ZENZ
Part Galifianakis, part Wittgenstein, Robert Zenz is all bad mother shut your mouth. He began writing and performing poetry at age 22, and hasn‘t looked back in almost 5 years. Last December he was invited to compete in Modesto California’s famed ILL LIST Slam Competition where he squared off against 7 national heroes including Taylor Mali and George Yamazawa. His work can be most easily found magneted to his mothers fridge in Fresno.


JORDAN RANFT
Within his first year in slam, Jordan Ranft has performed on stages from Colorado to California, while organizing multiple events in his home county of Sonoma, California. He performed on the same stage as Brother Ali, Chalie 2na, and Beats Antique at the Desert Rocks Music Festival. His work has been published in the award-winning Sonoma State literary journal Zaum Press, and the international online collection Bare Hands Poetry.

» THE PROBLEM? «

BOSTON?! THAT'S AWFUL FAR AWAY!

Indeed it is, child. Indeed it is. Plane tickets aren't the only hit to our wallet, however — though they definitely pack a punch. There's registration costs, hotel fees, transit around Boston, food ... While poetry is priceless, you can't pay for any of these things with a well-crafted metaphor and a smile. Believe me, we've tried.

» THE SOLUTION? «

HOW WILL THIS PARTY OF POWERHOUSE POETS DO IT?

The solution, dear reader, is you. With your help, we can make it across the country to show the world what Stockton really is — not just statistically the most unhappy city in the nation, or the largest city to declare bankruptcy, but a vital center of art, passion, and a fierce and fiery determination. We believe in Stockton. We're just asking you to believe in us.

GOT MONEY? If you got money, we got perks. We got perks for days! Whether you only have $5 in change, $20 in your pocket, or $1000 from that last lotto win, we have something special for you. Anything and everything is appreciated from the bottom of our bottomless hearts.

NO MONEY? If you don't got money, however, you can still help. Tell all your friends and family about us. Share this page everywhere — everywhere. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, bring back your old Myspace, plaster your car with Pierced Ear posters.

story:
This is a campaign to raise $20,000 to save a 180 year old Dutch Barn and art space situated in Clinton Corners,NY,Dutchess County, Hudson Valley.

This massive structure, built without the use of nails, is held together magically by design sense and wooden pegs. Robert Hedges, barn expert and trustee for The Society for the Preservation of Hudson Valley Vernacular Architecture, estimated this barn to have been built in 1830, as being a truly unique barn, possibly described as a Swing Beam Carriage Barn. 

The hurricanes and sustained rains of this past year have had disastrous effects on the barn. It presently needs a new roof and side wall or the building will collapse.This would be a big loss, not only for its historic and architectural significance, but as a space for the creation and exhibition of contemporary art by NY artists in a beautiful rural setting. For the last seven years, I have used this barn for creating artwork (lindseybrownstudio.com) as well as for hosting art events.

In 2007 there were two group shows curated at the barn by NY gallerist Rose Burlingham (roseburlingham.com) including work by Mary Carlson, Joanne Howard, Stephen Westfall, Cora Cohen, Christopher Stackhouse, Billy Copley, Paul Baumann, Marilyn Gold, Lindsey Brown,Catherine Croner, Mary Jones, Jerome Boutterin, Sue Carlson, Judy Hudson, Gwen Hardie, Stephen Mueller, Manuel Pardo, Larry Silver, Maggie Simonelli and poetry readings by: Mary Donnelly, Susan Kinsolving and Sam Truitt.

Upon the completion of this campaign, Rose Burlingham will curate the next Barn Show in June 2012.


The goal is to make necessary repairs to keep the barn standing for another 180 years. Any money raised in this campaign, will go directly toward replacing the roof and reconstructing the side wall.



Other Ways You Can Help-

please send suggestions,names of organizations or resources you think might be helpful to lindsey44@earthlink.netThank you!

story:
About Gender Unbound Art Fest

Gender Unbound Art Fest is a multi-discipline art festival that exclusively features transgender and intersex creators. We use art, music, and performance to celebrate an often marginalized community, empower gender diverse creators, and educate the general public in a context outside of celebrity coming out stories and bathroom legislation. We also connect attendees to much-needed services and organizations.


If you are a trans or intersex artist, musician, performer, or filmmaker who would like to participate in the festival, you can submit to be considered on our website until July 6th.

The 3rd annual Gender Unbound Art Fest will take place on Sept 29-30, 2018 in Austin, TX. The event is run by Gender Portraits, a sponsored nonprofit project of Austin Creative Alliance that documents and advocates for gender diverse people through art.

We need your help to make Gender Unbound 2018 a success!

What We Need

Gender Unbound is funded in part through a grant by the City of Austin Cultural Arts Division of Economic Development. After our fiscal sponsor’s fees are taken out, our $18,246 city grant will help pay for venue rental and event staffing as well as helping to provide stipends and travel expenses to artists, musicians, and performers. Other elements of the event will be sourced from donated goods—like merchandise (shirts and stickers) and signage.

But we still need your help to pay for other expenses, including our grant-required match amount of $9,123. Our [$5,000] funding goal (minus 5%-10% in Indiegogo fees) will pay for:

  • The remainder of the venue's rental fee
  • Event insurance (required by both city and venue contracts)
  • Equipment rentals: tables, chairs, audio equipment, assistive listening devices, etc.
  • Artist stipends: payments for featured musicians, performers, visual artists, filmmakers, etc.
  • Partial travel stipends: partial payment of travel and lodging costs for out-of-state artists
  • Contractor stipends: payments for photographer, videographer, sound tech, etc.
  • Administrative stipends: payments for the stage manager, volunteer coordinator, event organizer etc.
  • Screen printing donated shirts
  • Printing of tickets, badges, marketing, stickers, and signage
  • Event supplies: C-clamps, zip ties, tape, extension chords

If we pass our [$5,000] goal, additional funds will go toward:

  • Increasing all stipends: raising stipend amounts for all artists, musicians, performers, contractors, and administrators.
  • Full travel stipends: total payment of travel and lodging costs for out-of-state artists
  • Increasing Total Number of Artists: increasing number of artists (all types) we can feature both in and out of state.
  • Bringing in headliner acts: bringing nationally-known musicians and performers to the event
  • Gender Unbound Art Fest 2019: start-up funds for next year’s event

To be a fiscally responsible, we have taken care to minimize the amount of Indiegogo money spent on perk rewards. We've created substantial Indiegogo perks using high-value items that will already be created as a part of the festival like tickets, shirts, and art. This ensures that the maximum amount of raised funds will be spent on the festival. In addition, no Indiegogo funds will be used for shipping or handling of perks.

Perks

All perks will be delivered digitally or picked up in-person at the event to ensure that more funds are spent on the festival rather than on perk fulfillment costs. If you want to support Gender Unbound but can't make it to Austin for the festival, we recommend selecting perks for sponsored tickets and/or projected ads.

$6: One-Day Badge

Get an advance day badge to Gender Unbound 2018 for $6 (40% off the $10 at-the-door badge price).

$6: Sponsor a Day Badge

Sponsor a day badge to Gender Unbound 2018 for a community member!

Sponsored badges are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed to people they serve. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.

$10: Full Weekend Badge

Get a weekend badge to the Gender Unbound 2018 for $10 (33% off the $15 at-the-door badge price). Enjoy both days of the festival and our entire lineup of art, music, performances, and film.

$12: Day Badges for Two

Make it a date night or bring a friend! For $12 you get two one-day badges to Gender Unbound 2018 (40% off the at-the-door badge price), plus two Gender Unbound stickers to remember your awesome night together.

$12: Buy a Day Badge & Sponsor a Day Badge

You don't have to choose between treating yourself and giving back to the community. For $12 you get your own day badge to Gender Unbound 2018, sponsor a day badge for a community member, and get two Gender Unbound stickers!

Sponsored badges are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

$20: Weekend Badges for Two

Get a weekend badge to the Gender Unbound 2018 for $20 (33% off the $30 at-the-door badge price). Enjoy both days of the festival with your favorite companion and leave with a weekend of memories to share between you. Plus, receive four Gender Unbound stickers!

$22: Buy a Weekend Badge & Sponsor Two Day Badges

You don't have to choose between treating yourself and giving back to the community. For $22 you get your own full weekend badge to Gender Unbound 2018, sponsor two day badges for a community member, and get two Gender Unbound stickers!

Sponsored badges are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

$25: Shirt Package for One

Wear your support for trans and intersex artists on your sleeve! For $25 you get a Gender Unbound shirt that is screen printed by a local artist. These upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly and come in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors (picked up at the festival).

You'll receive a weekend badge to Gender Unbound 2018, a Gender Unbound shirt ($15 at the event), and two Gender Unbound stickers.

$45: Shirt Package for Two

Impress your +1 with Gender Unbound shirts for two! Remember the good times you shared at Gender Unbound and look great while doing it. For $45 you get two weekend badges to Gender Unbound, two Gender Unbound shirts, and four Gender Unbound stickers!

Gender Unbound shirts are screen printed by a local artist. These upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly and come in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors (picked up at the festival).

$60: Sponsor 10 Day Badges

Be a champion for the community! For $60 you will give 10 day badges to 10 trans/intersex community members. In addition, your name (or your organization's name) will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2018 patron wall!

Sponsored badges are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

$75: Art Bundle (only 5 offered)

Bring the festival home with you! For $75 you get an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2018 (over a $150 value). In addition to your new art collection, you'll get a weekend badge to Gender Unbound 2018, two Gender Unbound Stickers, and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles)!

$85: Quarter Page Ad in the Gender Unbound Program

Boost your message! For $85 you get a quarter page ad in the 2018 Gender Unbound program* for yourself, your business, or your non-profit (a $100 value)! Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the weekend as they use the festival program to look up schedules and other artist and performance information.

* All ads subject to approval from the Gender Unbound organizing team.

$120: Sponsor Twenty Day Badges

Be a community hero! For $120 you can spread joy by giving 20 day badges to 20 trans/intersex community members! In addition, your name will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2018 patron wall!

$150: Half Page Ad in the Gender Unbound Program

Stand out! For $150 you get a half page ad in the 2018 Gender Unbound program* for yourself, your business, or your non-profit (a $175 value)! Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the weekend as they use the festival program to look up schedules and other artist and performance information.

* All ads subject to approval from the Gender Unbound organizing team.

$200: Vendor Table

Connect with trans and intersex communities! Get one 6 ft table during both days of the festival your nonprofit organization or for profit business. Each of our previous one-day festivals had 300+ attendees. We expect 450+ attendees across the two days of the 2018 festival. A great opportunity to offer your products and services to hundreds of trans and intersex community members.

Trans and intersex artists do not need to purchase vending a table. They can submit through our artist submission form to be considered for a free space to sell their work.

$200: Full Page Ad in the Gender Unbound Program

Get Noticed! For $200 you get a half page ad in the 2018 Gender Unbound program* for yourself, your business, or your non-profit (a $250 value)! Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the weekend as they use the festival program to look up schedules and other artist and performance information.

* All ads subject to approval from the Gender Unbound organizing team.

$500: Festival Sponsor

Connect your business or nonprofit to the trans and intersex community! Become a sponsor of Gender Unbound Art Fest and your organization will be mentioned as a sponsor on our social media (3 posts), website, in the program (quarter page ad), and on-stage during the event. In addition, your organization will directly connect to hundreds of attendees through your own vendor table during the festival. 4 weekend badges will also be made available for your table attendants and guests.

$1000: Large Sponsor 

Go further to get your organization's services and products in the hands of the trans and intersex community! Materials about your business or nonprofit will be included in swag bags given to attendees and your sponsorship will be announced in an email blast to our subscribers. We will also list your organization as a sponsor on our social media (increased to 5 posts), website, in the program (increased to half page ad), and on-stage during the event. In addition, your organization will directly connect to hundreds of attendees through your own vendor table during the festival. 6 weekend badges will also be made available for your table attendants and guests.

$2000: Prime Sponsor (only 2 offered)

Ensure that your business or nonprofit is known by every attendee at the Gender Unbound Art Fest!  We will name you as the sponsor of either our festival's stage or art gallery! Attendees will be looking for their favorite artists in the Gender Unbound Stage/Gallery: Sponsored by (your co. name). Your stage/gallery sponsorship with be listed in the program, online, and on the physical wall of the gallery or stage. We will also mention your organization as a sponsor in all of our emails and event pages. We will only accept two Prime Sponsors (we only have one gallery and one stage) co act now!

You will also receive the perks included in other sponsor levels like materials included in attendee swag bags, sponsor mentions on social media (increased to 10 posts), mentioned on website, an ad in the program (increased to full page ad), and on-stage during the event. In addition, your organization will directly connect to hundreds of attendees through your own vendor table during the festival. 8 weekend badges will also be made available for your table attendants and guests.

Remember the good times you shared at Gender Unbound and look great while doing it. For $45 you get two weekend badges to Gender Unbound, two Gender Unbound shirts, and four Gender Unbound stickers!Gender Unbound shirts are screen printed by a local artist. These upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly and come in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors (picked up at the festival).$60: Sponsor 10 Day BadgesBe a champion for the community! For $60 you will give 10 day badges to 10 trans/intersex community members. In addition, your name (or your organization's name) will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2018 patron wall!Sponsored badges are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.$75: Art Bundle (only 5 offered)Bring the festival home with you! For $75 you get an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2018 (over a $150 value). In addition to your new art collection, you'll get a weekend badge to Gender Unbound 2018, two Gender Unbound Stickers, and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles)!$85: Quarter Page Ad in the Gender Unbound ProgramBoost your message! For $85 you get a quarter page ad in the 2018 Gender Unbound program* for yourself, your business, or your non-profit (a $100 value)! Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the weekend as they use the festival program to look up schedules and other artist and performance information.* All ads subject to approval from the Gender Unbound organizing team.$120: Sponsor Twenty Day BadgesBe a community hero! For $120 you can spread joy by giving 20 day badges to 20 trans/intersex community members! In addition, your name will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2018 patron wall!$150: Half Page Ad in the Gender Unbound ProgramStand out! For $150 you get a half page ad in the 2018 Gender Unbound program* for yourself, your business, or your non-profit (a $175 value)! Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the weekend as they use the festival program to look up schedules and other artist and performance information.* All ads subject to approval from the Gender Unbound organizing team.$200: Vendor TableConnect with trans and intersex communities! Get one 6 ft table during both days of the festival your nonprofit organization or for profit business. Each of our previous one-day festivals had 300+ attendees. We expect 450+ attendees across the two days of the 2018 festival. A great opportunity to offer your products and services to hundreds of trans and intersex community members.Trans and intersex artists do not need to purchase vending a table. They can submit through our artist submission form to be considered for a free space to sell their work.$200: Full Page Ad in the Gender Unbound ProgramGet Noticed! For $200 you get a half page ad in the 2018 Gender Unbound program* for yourself, your business, or your non-profit (a $250 value)! Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the weekend as they use the festival program to look up schedules and other artist and performance information.* All ads subject to approval from the Gender Unbound organizing team.$500: Festival SponsorConnect your business or nonprofit to the trans and intersex community! Become a sponsor of Gender Unbound Art Fest and your organization will be mentioned as a sponsor on our social media (3 posts), website, in the program (quarter page ad), and on-stage during the event. In addition, your organization will directly connect to hundreds of attendees through your own vendor table during the festival. 4 weekend badges will also be made available for your table attendants and guests.$1000: Large Sponsor Go further to get your organization's services and products in the hands of the trans and intersex community! Materials about your business or nonprofit will be included in swag bags given to attendees and your sponsorship will be announced in an email blast to our subscribers. We will also list your organization as a sponsor on our social media (increased to 5 posts), website, in the program (increased to half page ad), and on-stage during the event. In addition, your organization will directly connect to hundreds of attendees through your own vendor table during the festival. 6 weekend badges will also be made available for your table attendants and guests.$2000: Prime Sponsor (only 2 offered)Ensure that your business or nonprofit is known by every attendee at the Gender Unbound Art Fest!  We will name you as the sponsor of either our festival's stage or art gallery! Attendees will be looking for their favorite artists in the Gender Unbound Stage/Gallery: Sponsored by (your co. name). Your stage/gallery sponsorship with be listed in the program, online, and on the physical wall of the gallery or stage. We will also mention your organization as a sponsor in all of our emails and event pages. We will only accept two Prime Sponsors (we only have one gallery and one stage) co act now!You will also receive the perks included in other sponsor levels like materials included in attendee swag bags, sponsor mentions on social media (increased to 10 posts), mentioned on website, an ad in the program (increased to full page ad), and on-stage during the event. In addition, your organization will directly connect to hundreds of attendees through your own vendor table during the festival. 8 weekend badges will also be made available for your table attendants and guests.

story:
STORY

His shaving brush, his books, a handful of ties, his Hugo Awards … these are amongst the things my father left behind him when he died.

 

This book, beautifully designed and ready to print, contains a selection from the 9,000+ images I took of all my father’s things. There is a foreword by celebrated British novelist Christopher Priest and an essay by cultural sociologist Dr. Margaret Gibson.

 

With more than 250 pages of full color images, including 8 fold-outs, it is at once a depiction of one person’s property, a record of design across the decades and a meditation on the extraordinary nature of ordinary things

 

 

The pictures create a portrait of the person and prompts thoughts of our own possessions, what we keep and what we dispose of.

 

Possessions are a universal theme. Separated from their surroundings these objects lead us to contemplate the intrinsic value of design and the singular virtues of everyday things, and to consider the importance that we attach to our own material possessions, and what will become of them after our passing.  For those who have already had to deal with the disposal of a relative’s things it will resonate with their own experience.

 

My Dad (he was my Dad as well as my father) was Brian Aldiss, one of the most important voices in science fiction, writer, poet and artist, and so some of the photos in the book reflect this; not least his awards, early science fiction magazines and many, many books. Plenty there for Science Fiction fans to enjoy. There is also all the everyday stuff of life; playing cards, soap, family snaps and tea bags. 

 

Writer on Photography and Anthropology Elizabeth Edwards says: "Under Wendy Aldiss' incisive eye the heightening and theatrical propensities of photography come into play. Details rise up and grab attention".

With more than 250 pages of full color images, including 8 fold-outs, it is at once a depiction of one person’s property, a record of design across the decades and a meditation on the extraordinary nature of ordinary things
 
 
The pictures create a portrait of the person and prompts thoughts of our own possessions, what we keep and what we dispose of.
 
Possessions are a universal theme. Separated from their surroundings these objects lead us to contemplate the intrinsic value of design and the singular virtues of everyday things, and to consider the importance that we attach to our own material possessions, and what will become of them after our passing.  For those who have already had to deal with the disposal of a relative’s things it will resonate with their own experience.
 
My Dad (he was my Dad as well as my father) was Brian Aldiss, one of the most important voices in science fiction, writer, poet and artist, and so some of the photos in the book reflect this; not least his awards, early science fiction magazines and many, many books. Plenty there for Science Fiction fans to enjoy. There is also all the everyday stuff of life; playing cards, soap, family snaps and tea bags. 
 
Writer on Photography and Anthropology Elizabeth Edwards says: "Under Wendy Aldiss' incisive eye the heightening and theatrical propensities of photography come into play. Details rise up and grab attention".

story:
Short Summary

I am a junior in high school and I am starting to look for ways to learn life skills and get experience in new situations. This summer, I would like to attend two camps that I think will help me improve as an artist and a person. One of them is a fine and applied arts camp in my hometown's university. The other camp is a camp focused on helping LGBT youth build useful leadership skills.

To partially fund my tuition to these camps, I decided to sell art commissions. I have previously done a similar commissions campaign to fund a summer language exchange to South Korea last year, which was a very successful and formative experience for me. Donating to my campaign will get you the satisfaction of knowing you helped me experience something formative this summer, and it will also get you a personalized piece of art!

What You Get

If you would like to commission a drawing from me, you can email me your idea and any pictures for reference that you might want me to use, and donate a minimum amount to my campaign (depending on what kind of drawing you commissioned). 

I would like to reach $1500 from this campaign, but I am giving out perks starting from smaller donations. This means that if you donate 15 dollars or more, you are guaranteed to receive a personalized drawing made by me! 

Here's a chart of minimum donations to receive to get a certain perk:

 

 

Inked (1 or 2 ppl)

Colored (1 or 2)

Inked (2 and up)

Colored (2 and up)

Head/Bust

15

20

25

35

Torso

20

25

30

40

Full Body

35

40

45

55

 

If there is something you would like to commission that is not on this chart, send me an email, and we will decide on a price.

To get more of an idea of my drawing style, check out my instagram account @androgenie80.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't buy a drawing, that's not a problem! You can also help me by following this campaign, and sharing it on your favorite social media platforms and through email. Spread the word to all your friends and family! I am thankful for any way you can support me.
